text: Bottle - bright cloudy orange, decent white head. Good yeasty orange aroma. Ting on tongue but fine. Decent tasting weiss! Very refreshing on hot day.
Orange-braun, blickdicht trüb mit weißem Schaum. Geruch fruchtig, malzig. Geschmack malzig leicht süß mit ausgewogenen Nelken und Bananenaromen. Im Anhang etwas bitter. Gutes Weißbier.
Well, thesenguys know what theyre doing, for sure. Some bananas and wheat, but very creamy and smooth. Top notch beer.

Very appealing looking beer with an amber body topped by a foamy white head. Excellent refreshing beer ideal for summer. Yeasty banana taste, a little of cloves and spice. I'd be happy to drink a few of these

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle at Beerdock Leek. Pours a hazy orange colour with a thick white head. Aroma of banana, clove, cereal malts, slight orange, a little lemon, a hint of pepper and subtle wheat. Taste of banana, clove, cereal malts, bready malts, slight orange, a little pepper, a hint of wheat and subtle vanilla. Medium bodied and high carbonation. A dry, peppery, banana bitterness in the finish. A very good weissbier, full of flavour. Really good body and super refreshing.
Hazy gold pour with a sizable white cap. Sweet and fruity, mostly banana. Id like more clove but this is still very nice.
Platano y clavo en nariz. Algo de levadura en boca. Ligeramente ácida con buen cuerpo y bien carbonatada. BB 11/10/17

0,5 l bottle. Pours hazy light golden yellow with big thick white head. Aroma of banana, vanilla, some light clove, malt and bread. More on banana side this one. Taste is light sweet, very light bitter and a hint of sourness. Body is on the light side, texture is slick, carbonation average to lively. Body wise this hefe one is on the light side, banana dominates aroma, delicious and refreshing.

500mL bottle. Pours hazy yellow with a large, foamy white head. Aroma is banana, bubblegum, clove, and peach. Taste is banana, melon, vanilla, clove, and wheat. Light-medium body. Moderate carbonation. Smooth, creamy mouthfeel.

50cl bottle. Large white head atop murky apple cider body. Aroma is moderately sweet, apple, banana, some bubblegum, apricot, light clove. Taste is moderately sweet, banana, some bubblegum, light clove, apple, yeast spicy. Effervescent light-medium body.
Zitronig frischer Antrunk, hefiger Körper mit feinen Bananennoten und leichter Säure. Im Abgang Gewürznelken und eine kleine Hopfenbittere schmeckbar.
Classic weizen look. Aroma of banana, a bit of clove, bubblegum. Taste is light sweet, very little bitternes. Nicely balanced and clean. Light body, oily texture, average carbonation.
From tap at 3 små rum i Göteborg. Andechs Klosterbrauerei, Tremendous beer from a Brewery otherwise hard to find on tap in Sweden.

Ar: Bright, tart peach; underripe banana; a touch of white pepper and clove. Ap: Pale gold and slightly hazy; large white head with very good retention, airy and soapy in appearance. T: Fairly prominent peach and banana up front; doughy pure light malt flavor; low sweetness; a touch of black pepper and clove; stone fruit skins mingle with medium-low bitterness and herbal noble hop flavor; finish is peach, orange peel, and a lingering bitterness. P: Medium-light body with very high carbonation, relatively lush and creamy; finish is medium-dry. O: A textbook German hefeweizen; banana and clove flavors are prominent and pure but not overdone; nice background notes of fresh malt, black pepper, and clove, also well-integrated; superbly drinkable, full of flavor, and refreshing!

On tap at Beer oclock Bucharest. Very good refreshing weizen. Fruity aroma, lemon, banana, smooth white head, hazy yellow colour. Full taste with lemons, cinnamon, banana, not too sour, slightly sweet finish.

500 ml from tap at Andechser in Mering. Served in Weizenbier glass. Very nice pale orange-yellow colour, medium white head. Banana, yeast, hay, lemon. Very balanced taste, slightly bitter, grassy, yeasty and sour hint. Oily texture, medium body, soft carbonated. Very nice!
Bottle from a local supermarket in bensheim. Nose is citrus, banana, bubblegum, floral, intense dried banana. Palate is banana, spicy, floral, citrus, bread. Great weizen!

Hazy translucent golden (or slightly darker), healty and pretty dense head, nice retention and lacing. Aroma is mainly freshly fruity (melon, light banana, lemonish touch) with a hint of spiciness and maybe a hint of bubblegum. Taste has a bit of white/soft bread foundation, lemonish and melon notes, a hint of clove in the finish. Overall its pretty refreshing, obviously sweet (averagely so for the style) with a slight hint of acidity. Light bodied with good, soft carbonation resulting in a slightly creamy but still very easy mouthfeel. A pretty good hefe, not too remarkable in terms of intensity, but very well made and enjoyable.

Bottle. Cloudy pale orange. Great head. Aroma of yeast, lemons and some bananas. Taste is citrus fruits and yeast. Full bodied. Sour and spritzy. Medium carbonation. I love Andechs and this is a decent Hefeweizen but there are better ones out there.

Botella en 99Cervezas.

Vierte en amarillo pálido y algo turbio. Gran formación de espuma de color blanco roto, de burbuja media, notable persistencia y buena adherencia.

En nariz es de intensidad media-alta, dando inmediatamente notas de plátano en su punto tremendamente agradables. Algunas notas florales muy de fondo, como de violeta. También algo de clavo y de pimienta blanca, ambos muy de fondo, así como algo de miel y un puntito cítrico. Complejidad media y buen equilibrio.

De entre los sabores básicos destaca sobre todo el dulce, aunque es muy contenido y nada empalagoso. Las notas de plátano que encontrábamos en nariz se refuerzan en boca. También aparece una muy muy ligera acidez y un aun casi más ligero amargor.

De peso medio en boca, se siente inmediatamente espumosa, con una sensación como de mousse. Bastante refrescante para una cerveza de este dulzor. La persistencia en boca es media, lo que en este caso es algo positivo para evitar resultar empalagosa. Aun así parece adquirir más cuerpo conforme evoluciona en boca y acaba pesando en la lengua.

Buena bebestibilidad y agradable de tomar. Frutal y cremosa. Altamente recomendable.
Bottle. Hazy yellow colour with white head. banana and wheat aroma. Sweet, wheat, banana, spices taste, some yeast. Medium body.

DOB: L15952015 BJCP Category: 10A Weissbier
AROMA: A light fruity taste of banana yeast esters, orange and some green pear. Minor bubblegum and clove scents in the background. Seems to have a subtle skunky scent, but it is not distracting. 8/12APPEARANCE: Burnished gold hue; body is hazy but clearer than most. Large bright white foam persists and laces well. 3/3FLAVOR: Light palette overall with a wheaty/bready base without any raw graininess or maillard products. Banana yeast esters emerge on the second half along with slight orangepeel. Clove-like phenols lurk in the background throughout to add a faint trace of spice. A light sour tang or tartness is briefly present right as it finishes but is not off-putting. No hop bitterness or flavor to speak of. 14/20MOUTHFEEL: Medium-light body with moderate carbonation. Feels much lighter than 5.5% ABV as its a little watery in texture. Very refreshing and a clean aftertaste is nice. 3/5OVERALL IMPRESSION: I prefer a more robust hefeweizen, but the easy drinkability of this makes up for it. Probably an old bottle, but quite enjoyable. 7/10TOTAL SCORE: 35/50

Rated on 10-17-2016. (Bottle) When poured. the appearance is a huge fizzy tan head that mostly diminished, light hazy yellow body, fizzy carbonation, and spotty lacing. The aroma presents wheat, banana, fruity, spicy, clove, sweet, and malt. The flavor presents banana, wheat, banana, spicy, clove, malt and sweet. The mouthfeel is moderate carbonation, watery and thin. This beer is light bodied. The end result is this beer is very light tasting and thin. It is an okay beer, but nothing special stood out for this beer.
Cask. Yellowy Gold. Refreshing, clean, crisp wheatbeer. Wheaty, yeasty. Banana & lemon-citrus fruity, spicy. Sweetish with some slight sourness. Dry fruity wheaty finish. Nice beer! (2008)

Draft at man in the moon
Hazy yellow, white head.
Aroma of marshmallow banana sour
Taste nice banana, round nice.
Draught. Pours hazy orange with a white head. Aroma and taste has notes of Banana and wheat.

500 ml bottle from Pearl Street Beverage, Burlington VT, served probably a little too cold in a Weihenstephan weizen glass. Typically large foamy head near-fills the glass, but doesnt hold as strongly as many, and as it disappears the bright hazed gold peeks forth with alacrity...banana-bubblegum-clove, you know the drill, also a bit of pepper and a touch of lime, not all the potent or forward...the body is fairly juicy but also not as soft or creamy as I would usually hope for, its a bit over-carbonated and watery, though the yeast presence comes on nicely with a few sips and a bit more warmth...drier and more citric than most, and, ultimately, rather bland unfortunately. A disappointment; from my experience with the Doppelbock Dunkel and now this, and after reading more than a couple of reviews indicating that this brewerys best days might be behind it, I have to say I sure wish Id been able to get to Germany a decade or more ago. Sigh.

Appearance: heavily hazy, pale, golden, white foam, rocky head, lasts well. Aroma: wheat, yeast, banana. Taste: light sweetness, lightly sour, medium bitterness. Cinnamon.medium body, thin feel, soft carbonation, mild finish.
hazy yellow liquid with white head. aroma of banana, coriander, fish. tastes same, cinnamon, light sweetness, medium bitterness, lightly sour. light body, creamy, average carbonation, long finish,

Bottle. Pours hazy/cloudy yellow with nice white firm head. Aroma: sweetish, wheat, cardemom, banana, yeasty. Taste: sweetish with some balancing sourness, yeasty, malty, cardamom. up to medium body. Ok

Turbia y con mucho sedimento. Al servirla genera una cabeza de espuma blanca y esponjosa que retiene de maravilla.

Es una cerveza muy rica en nariz, como muy afrutada. De hecho, en el rato que tardes en jincártela vas a poder apreciar además de la mantequilla propia de este tipo de alemanas, manzana verde, uva y plátano.

En boca es muy fiel al estilo, aquí los bávaros no se andan con tonterías y se innova poco o nada. Densa y cremosa por tanto, pero mucho más refinada y ligera que otras.

5. 12. 2016, Ljubljana. Bottled. Proper heffe-weizen, medium body with lasting rich foam. Fruity aromas and taste.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours light golden and hazy with a nice cream head. Nose of bananas, Bacon and baked beans. Taste is nice and creamy with some citrus and plenty of wheat. Nice and refreshing.

Pours cloudy blonde color with medium frothy, dense head. Nose is tons of cloves, yeast, banana, wheat, grass. Taste is spicy and sweet. Cloves, spicy herbs. Lively carbonation (maybe a bit too lively), medium body. Spicy finish.

On tap at the brewery. Really hazy, milky looking, peach color with white head. Aroma is full of banana esters and sweet honey malt. Taste has also banana shake flavor with some cloves and smooth yeast. Medium to full bodied with medium to high carbonation. A really well made, traditional hefeweizen.

Pours unclear blonde small white head. Smell is intense. German buttery yeasts. Taste is full, buttery yeasty, overripe banana, vey low carbo. Typical German style beer. Stillnot my thing but not repulsive or bad in Quality.

Bottle shared thanks to sjogro. Hazy yellowy golden with nice white head. Cloves up front with a very light smoky touch. Like smoked cloves. Followed by unripe banana, light lemon rind, dough. Its light sweet with super fresh tartness, like drinking ice cold spring water. Very light herbal and yeasty bitter finish. Just medium bodied with surprisingly light feel, no cloying dough here it there is a decent wheat thickness. Nice.

At Maakuns. Shared from bottle. Sweet grain, banana milkshake, light hoppy bitter, thin smokey layer. Medium sweet, light bitter. Medium body, very supple fresh feel, mineral water, soft carbonation. Bittersweet overripe banana finish with faint lemon zest. Makes me want more. Good stuff.
Z kranu w Adechser am Dom. Bardzo dobry pszeniczniak - banany i goździki są, bardzo pijalne. Jedynie w aromacie lekka siarka.

Botella en una @Cata. 16/10/16 BBD:02/03/17
Color amarillo, aroma platano, sabor cereal
Grande Weiss dal colore perfetto, al naso croccante e cereali. Buonissima al palato con una vena amara.
50cl bottle from beermerchants. Hazy gold to orange color. Thin white head. Medium body. Smooth carbonation. Finish is medium. Aroma is banana, clove, herby, light bubblegum, light citric.

Bottle: &nbsp First glance is carbonation, fairly strong. &nbsp Thin to moderate frothy white head, little lacing. &nbsp Airy on the tongue, wheaty, soft clove. &nbsp Not as much bubblegum or banana as others. &nbsp Slightly more complex than American examples, but still not as spicy as other Germans. &nbsp Moderate body and mouthfeel. &nbsp BURP! &nbsp Yeah, that carbonation needs to go somewhere. &nbsp Not as full as others either. &nbsp Decent example, but lighter for a German version.
TAP at Beer Zone, Iași. Very murky bright golden. Juicy fruit and weigh clove, a bit of boiled vegetables. Sweetish bready and wheaty, but lacks the crispness and spiciness. Decent.
0,5l can. A cloudy pale weizen with a rich white head. Fruity aroma with notes of banana, mandarin, spices, citrus and wheat. Flavour is spiced with a dry note.

12-09-16 // 500ml bottle. Hazy golden orange colour with big white head. Strong wheat aroma with typical banana. Very smooth, nice slightly creamy palate. Banana clove, strong yeast. Medium sweet, moderate carbonation. Really good weizen.

From tap: Unclear golden orange apricot with medium head; aroma is overripe banana, fresh yeast; taste is sweet fruity banana with gentle spicy finish; thick creamy mouthfeel with thin to medium body and medium carbonation
16.9 oz. bottle. Pours a hazy pale golden color with a fluffy white head. Aroma of wheat, banana, spice and yeast. Taste follows nose. Good.

Full bottle. This is an good hefeweizen. Dark orange and entirely opaque appearance. Full aroma and flavor, banana, clove, some bubblegum. Flavor is not quite as rich and full as some others, but this is still better than most others. Medium sweet.

Pours light yellow/honey with huge foamy head. Despite the fizz the carbonation is soft on the tongue and is a light beer overwall. Toasted wheat, clove, banana, touch of stone fruit, light hop finish.

Color dorado amarillento con capa de espuma blanca de más de un dedo de grosor (se disipa antes que en otras cervezas de trigo). Carbonatación a tope (no tan presente en boca). Aroma a trigo, pan y plátano. Sabor típico de Hefeweizen, similar a la Paulaner Naturtrüb. Con más matices y sabor más redondo que otras Hefeweizen, pero tampoco nada que me rompa los esquemas. Disfrutable.
Frisch vom Hahn in Meissen getrunken. Trübes Gold mit weißer Schaumkrone im Glas. Ausgewogen im Geschmack.

16.9oz bottle 8/8/16 (Binnys-Naperville)-48° in Weizen Glass-Pours a murky orange with a small white head. Aroma of clove, banana coriander, and wheat. Taste of the same with spices coming in on the back end. This light to medium bodied brew is well balanced and hits the spot on a hot day.

Bottle from Mollie Stones in Belmont, CA. Aroma is fruity floral, light banana. Taste is yeasty, light and refreshing fruits. Really like most of the beers that Andechser does but honestly I thought this was a bit thin / watery. Needed a minor punch up in flavor.
Cloudy , orange color. Huge , off-white head. Classic weizen aroma of wheat, clove and banana. Wheat, yeasts and fruits in taste. Great beer.
Another good Weissbier, but not strong enough. Sampled at the Tap & Growler, Eugene, OR.

Tap. Pours Cloudy yellow/gold. Aroma of banana, yeast, cloves and bubblegum. Nice and smooth with nicely balanced flavor. Fresh and drinkable, went down in about 5 minutes on a warm summers day in Munich.

This is a fantastic Weissber specimen, hitting all of the right criteria for the style. Not very sweet, but still has hints of banana and fully yeasty/bready/wheaty as it should be. Effervescent, thinnish body that goes right down. Nicely turbid and somewhat tart finish.

0,5 l Flasche. Aroma: Hefig. Erscheinung: Orangegelbes, trübes Bier, flacher, schnell abbauender cremeweißer Schaum. Geschmack: süßlich, hefig, kaum bitter. Nachgeschmack: Süße hält sich, schön cremig auf der Zunge. Gesamt: Gutes Weizen.
0,5l Flasche. Orangenes Bier mit schöner Schaumkrone. Hefiger Geruch, typisches Weizenbier.

Bottle 0.5
Очень крутой вайцен с красиво& пенной шапкой и классич& шикарны& вкусом.

500 ml bottle purchased from Lifesource natural Grocers in Salem OR.
$3,99
Cloudy bright yellow beer with a huge rocky thick white head.
Aromas of lemon and wheat, bready with some banana
Taste is way better then the aroma..the banana and bubble gum far more to the front.
Nice smooth medium mouth feel.
A great traditional weiss bier.
Bottled. Pours hazy unfiltered pale yellow, white head. Aroma is banana, lemon, clove, wheat. Flavor is wheat, banana, bubblegum, lemon. Nice. Good quality German Weisse Bier.

500 ml bottle, no dating that I was able to find on it. Back label is stamped with L 1035. Served in a weizen glass, the beer pours a hazy gold color with about an inch and a half that stuck around for a long time. Theres also a good amount of lacing. Aroma is nice, the brew smells like cloves, bananas, and wheat/grainy malt. For the most part I think the taste is similar to the aroma, but theres also some bubblegum and a little bit of lemon peel noticable. Mouthfeel/body is medium, its creamy with a good amount of carbonation. I thought this was a good hefeweizen, Id buy this one again. Certainly worth a try! $3.49 a bottle.
Bottle shared at home. Hazy yellow colour, medium white head. Nose and taste isntipical weizen, low to now esters. Decent weizen.

Aus der Flasche. Orange trübe Farbe, sehr schöner heller fester Schaum. Getreidiger Hefeduft. Angenehm reduzierte Kohlensäure. Herb getreidig im Antrunk. Dann Hefe und Süsse. Etwas alkoholisch. Sanft bitteres Finish. Klassisches Weizenbier.

Pours a hazy yellow colour with a big compact head. Aroma of banana, cloves and citrus (less than usual for the style). Medium body, fizzy carbonation with bubbles coming up all the time. Taste of banana, cloves and citrus.

Pour is a cloudy yellow with a huge white head. Aroma is typical hefe. Banana and clove with wheat malt base and maybe even some vanilla. Flavor is a little on the thin side with the banana and clove being the main thing I detect. A bit of metal toward the end which was kind of weird. Typical but thin German hefe.

Flasche - goldgelb mit dicker Schaumkrone. Sehr gut abgestimmtes Weizen, wenig nervige bananige Noten, allerdings sticht auch sonst kaum etwas richtig heraus. Gewürzig. Durchaus ein gutes Weizen, aber mit 96 hier hart overrated, wie praktisch alle deutschen Biere, die in den USA verkauft werden.

This was poured into a weizen glass.
The appearance was a hazy/cloudy burnt orange color with a thick rocky/foamy white head that took its time to dissipate. Rough messy lacing.
The smell started off with the spicy clove up front and then the sweet banana esters, slightly earthy, subtle biscuit.
The taste wrapped together all of the previously mentioned flavors with the sweet breadiness lingering into the spicy clove in the aftertaste nicely.
On the palate, this one sat about a light to medium in body. Spices hit with a gentle harshness on my tongue.
Overall, damn, what a nice hefeweizen. Definitely would have again.

May. 15. On tap at Andechser am Dom. Hazy yellow bodied with typically big head. Very nice in-style aroma, banana and orange were screaming out of it. Flavor was mildly sweet, chalky, fruity, creamy and smooth on palate. Medium bodied with low carbonation accompanied with pleasant finish that followed the flavor. Again, very good, scholar Hefeweizen example, but still expected a bit better somehow.

Bottle, 0.50l. Cloudy golden color with medium frothy white head and average sparkling appearance. Aroma of wheat, yeast, banana and cloves. Taste starts light sweet grainy and honeyish, follows refreshing citric and grassy with mild spicy mouthfeel and light bitter finish. Light to medium body, slick texture and average carbonation in palate. Well done, but not so special, although I might be a bit spoiled...

One of my favourite weizen! Aroma is light fruit. Not only banana also apple and other sweet stuff. Taste is very mild in perfect harmony with the aroma. Silky smooth mouthfeel that is long lasting. Overall very good.

Pours cloudy light orange from the bottle. The expected sweet banana aroma is accompanied by something more tart - in the direction of green apple. Taste is the expected Weizen, accompanied with bread, banana and the advertised honey melon notes. Very pleasant. The beer has a little bit more carbonation than I would expect in a Weizen and at the outset this seems mask the finish. However as the session progressed the dry and short if crisp ending was increasingly replaced by a lingering sweetness. Very good stuff.

Faint dried banana/dried apple (+ melon?) fruit on nose, which for my money also smells a little vegetal (butternut squash/parsnip). Mild clove/cardamom ting going on, as well. Really creamy and soft, yet serious  like a magnolia-painted trapdoor? Medium-length finish, after a little lemon in the mouth. A very, very classy affair; amen, those Benedictine lads! Tonight, I feel like I slightly prefer the funkier, more bolshy Weihenstephan Hefe (sampled yesterday), but yknow if you put those two head-to-head, I think the Andechsers slinkiness could shade it.

Been a while since I rated a German beer, or a good hefe for that matter. With the boom of American craft, you see the German beers less and less. Too bad in a way. Enough rambling. Pours hazy gold, nice big head. Textbook. Aroma is wheat and cloves, touch of banana. Flavor matches, more emphasis on clove spice than other components. Good wheat backbone. As it warms up, banana esters make themselves more known and more balanced with the phenols. Nice brew.
500 ml bottle. Hazy yellow colour with huge stable head off. Aroma typical for wheat beer with banana notes and yeasts. Taste is really balanced, spicy aftertaste,full body,great wheat beer.
Tap at Busters. This is money in its style. Hazy yellow pour with a dense coating head. Wheat and yeast, mild banana and clove. Soft palate that is just a bit chewy. Great beer.
Bottle. Been meaning to check this one off for a while. Pours a hazy straw color with a large puffy white head. Notes of honey, light rubber sneaker, and yeast. Technically right on the money.
Hazy golden orange with a creamy white head. Aroma of banana, bubblegum, wheat and coriander. Taste: Banana, yeast, wheat and citrus.

Bottle:
Pours hazy, light yellow with a huge white head.
Banana, wheat, mild clove aroma.
Flavour is soft wheat malt, banana, sweet lemon/citrus.
Wonderful.....you wont find many better than this one.
Hazy white-yellow color with white foam. Aroma of clove and coriander. Taste of banana, citrus-like bit and cloves.

0.5l bottle from hieber, 1.00.
pours a cloudy orange with a big white head and a nice lacing. mild aroma of bananas, cloves, spices. rather tart flavour of banana, oranges, herbs, lemon zest, pepper, grass. strong carbonation. a very refreshing weizen.
Pours hazy gold into a wizen. Bright white head with excellent retention recedes leaving spot lacing. Banana aromas. Sharp with banana and clove front to back and into the dry abrupt finish.
UPDATED: MAR 17, 2016 Cerveza de trigo muy buena, muy aromática. Cuerpo medio, con medio gas. Deja una sabor largo y bueno.

Pours hazy golden color with nice and creamy white head. Smell of banana, yeast and wheat.

Full body with medium carbonation. Very thick and creamy texture. Taste is sweet and fruity. Banana, wheat, yeast, spices, a bit grassy. Very rich and very complex.

Overall, beautiful beer. A poetry in a bottle. Loved it!

The beer pours very hazy golden orange with a good sized white head. The aroma has rich wheat, candied banana, cloves and cream. It has a pretty full body with very underscored carbonation. The flavor has much of whats on the aroma with some spicy hops and a hint of lemons. The finish gets a bit crisp. Really nice hefe.
500 ml. bottle. Pours a cloudy gold with a nice white head. Aroma of fruit, grain, yeast, and spice. Taste is banana, wheat, yeast, and cloves. A delight to drink.

Bottle 50cl BB 9/16
Cloudy dark yellow, creamy head. A nice example of Weissbiers Hell and one of the bests Ive tryied.
Typical German bright "Weißbier". However, quite fruity and zingy. Very pale and smooth. If you like yeast, this is it!
Légère, épicée et aux bons arômes de levures/bananes.Fine acidité, fruitée.Bonne weiss !

Perfect hefeweizen - does everything that its meant to. Cloudy straw colour with sticky white head. Nose is stuffed full of banana and clove, in the mouth you also get bread and honey, palate is smooth. Some of these beers fade and get watery at the end, but not this one. Great.
Fad i klosteret Andechs. Sådan skal en hvedeøl dufte smage og se ud. Dejlig øl i skønne omgivelser.

500 ml bottle at Orvars. Cloudy dark golden with big white head. Aroma with banana, orange, wheat malt and yeast. Taste is light, wheat, slight cloves, light banana, slight tart with high carbonation.
Pale color, very clear for hefe. Banana notes, slight yeasty. Smooth flavor, rich. Nice lasting.
Sample at Örebro Öl & Whisky 2015. Typical wheat beer aromas with foam banana and fruits. Similar taste. Nice and refreshing.

Flasche 0,5l: Golden, kräftige Trübung, kräftiger feinporiger Schaum; frische, leicht würzige Nase mit Getreidenaromen, leicht malziger Süße, Hefearomen; leicht würzig Körper, Getreidenoten, leicht geröstetes Malz, kräftige Hefearomen, Gäraromen, leicht nussig; eher trockener Nachgang
bottle oro velata schiuma buona persistenza banane fenolico presenti ma non invasivo lieve acidità un po corta citrico finale

Ein sehr, sehr süßes Weissbier. Mir persönlich sogar schon zu süß und zu bananig. Die Weizentypische Säuerlichkeit ist zu sehr im Hintergrund.
Im Aroma extrem bananig, Nelke, Brot, Karamell.
Im Geschmack viiiiiiiel Banane und Karamell, Honig, Brot, ein wenig Getreide.
Lecker, aber mit ein wenig mehr Säure wäre es noch angenehmer.

Pours a very cloudy and very dark golden orange color with dark golden banana-yellow colored edges and a massive three finger, pillowy white head that very slowly settles into a lasting ring. Great retention, coating the glass with large chunks of soapy lacing on the way down. 

Lots of spice in the nose with a strong peppery clove presence along with prominent malted wheat and a heavy bread/yeast character. Just a touch of banana with a strong citrus/lemon zest presence. As it warms, Im also picking up a bit of melon, grapefruit and blood orange. The nose is dominated by clove and peppery spice but the citrus element really opens up after a while. 

Full body with a zesty spice presence up font that lingers over the bready yeast, banana and sweet citrus notes into a slight tart, dry finish. Heavy peppery clove flavor up front but it is nicely countered by wheat, sourdough bread, banana and a very prominent citrus flavor. Lots of zesty lemon pith as well as some grapefruit and juicy blood orange. Very refreshing and although the mouthfeel is kind of heavy, its pretty easy to drink.
500ml bottle: poured a brilliant deep yellow with a medium sized fluffy white head. Moderate aroma of yeast with light banana. Very clean tasting with a crisp finish. One of the greats in its class.

bread, caramel, banana, bubblegum, clove, toast, floral. amber, cloudy, white foam, frothy, good retention. light sweetness, lightly bitter, medium body, creamy, lively, long finish that is slighty sweet and gently bitter. good one

Draft @ Kloster Andechs in Nov. 2011: Cloudy golden. Voluminous and persistent cap of tiny-bubbled meringue adorns the glass. Bright aroma of fresh baked spiced apples, plastic- and clove-like phenolics, banana cream pie, white raisin, tropical fruit, bubblegum, pineapple, and an abundance of floral Hallertau. Expressive carbonation is fluffy and creamy. Tad watery body. Delicate pineapple acids dovetail with a spicy-sweet dessert apple vibrancy. Pronounced airy phenol and clove notes cleanse the palate and pave the way for a creamy banana puree suppleness. Wheat is very polished, fluffy and starchy and harmonizes beautifully with the Hallertau-derived honeysuckle nectar. Quenching nectarine- and pear-like acids add tremendous lift to the beefy wheat and fluffy, yet perfectly understated, bubblegum center. Ongoing floral luster graces the exquisitely balanced finish which is awash with banana cream pie flavors and sassy clove spice. Plasticlike phenols emerge in each tasty belch. A tasty weissbier that showcases bright and clean fermentation byproducts along with elegant hoppiness and great malt character. During our visit to the Kloster, all three of the lagers (Jubiläumsbier Dunkel Naturtrüb, Doppelbock Dunkel, and the flagship Dunkel,) were curiously mediocre to poor (DMS in most of them), and this rock solid weissbier emerged as the clear winner.

text: Bottle. Cloudy dense yellow with a touch of orange liquid. Average pale yellow foam with orange sediment. Medium body and carbonation. A bit watery but very good. Taste of grains and banana.

Draught. Hazy orange Body with nice large white head. Aroma is yeast rip fruits especially banana. Taste is some wheat malt with a little bit of sourness. Aftertaste is lightly bitter and dry with some sweetness. Nice one.
Cloudy yellow/orange color, average sized white head. Huge banana aroma, wheat, yeast. Medium body, soft carbonation. Very fruity and tastes delicious. Excellent hefeweizen, one of the best.

On gravity dispense at GBBF 2014. Cloudy amber huge white head. Nose is rich clove , wheaty malt, cereal grain, light banana, apple, and some darker fruitiness. For a weizen its quite a heavy, fruity beer, oily texture.

Bottle 0.5L.
Hazy, golden body with huge, creamy, white head, fully lasting with nice lacing.
Moderate malty (grains) and hoppy (orange) aroma with intense notes of fruits (banana and apple) and light spices; some light yeasty character is also detected.
Moderate sweet and light bitter flavour with some moderate acidic note.
Light-to-medium body with oily texture; lively carbonation; light astrincency in the finish.

Pours hazy yellow/orange with a white, creamy head. Aroma is very fruity with notes of banana, pineapple, peach and some clove. Taste is fruity too but has also notes of honey, yeast and clove. Slightly sour finish. Lively carbonation, full body. Excellent and delicious hefeweizen. (0,5 l bottle, best before 21 Feb. 2015)
cereal, pale, hazy, white foam, light sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, medium body, thin feel, lively

Eine nette perlenweiße Schaumkrone.
Hazy bright golden body. 
Aroma; wheat malts, flowers, clove, ginger, sweets.
Taste; wheat malts, grassy hops, leaves, glue, apples, bananas, grass, ginger and clove. Smooth and slick on palate. Finishes with the fruits, bread and alcohol.
Overall that alcohol disturbed the moment, but Ive tried to overlook it.
[50 cl. br btl. 5.5%abv. °. BB01.08.14]
Excellent Weissbier. Full flavoured and refreshing. Very light Amber colour with medium creamy white head. Would have again and keen to try other variations from Andechs

Clásica cerveza de trigo. Color amarillo claro, buena formación de espuma y buena estabilidad. Aroma y sabor a plátano y clavo. En boca se percibe más intensamente la malta y notas intensas de levadura. Retrogusto de suave acidez y especias. Buen cuerpo y buena carbonatación, muy refrescante y buena representante del estilo típico de Baviera. (Botella, 500 ml)

Draught from bar castello, malcesine. Cloudy golden ale with an impressive foamy white head. Nutty and fruity with banana and apricot. Taste is sweet and slightly sour, dry and long lasting. Carbonation is prickly and body medium. Not bad.

500 ml bottle. Cloudy honey gold color. Large rocky white head. Aroma has notes of yeast, buttery wheat malt, banana and melon. Flavor is tangy fruit with sweet notes of honey and banana. Very subtle yeasty notes. Lemony citrus hops in finish. Very nice and drinkable. An outstanding example of A Bavarian weissbier.

Tasted under its old name Andechser Weissbier Hefetrüb. Typical German Hefeweizen with a very thick and rocky, almost ice-cream like, sticky head and a murky, ochre blonde colour. Aroma has wheat, vanilla, iron, bread, freshly cut pear, some white pepper; taste a gentle and subdued sweetishness, somewhat powdery mouthfeel, a bit metallic, light wheat sourishness, refreshing, finish light sourish and grainy, thirst-quenching.
Cloudy yellow amber colour with a lasting, medium tall white head. Fruity aroma and taste. Definitely great hefeweizen

On tap at Andechser am Dom Munich. Cloudy gold pour with lacy white head. Aroma is fruity, good banana clove, peach notes in there as well, particularly fruity, nice floral graininess that isnt completely crushed by esters. Taste is light, fruity, not really spicy, very light yeast profile which is enjoyable, bready and vnever cloying. Palate is a bit on the rough side, found it harshly carbed, body is med-light though. Nice.

Refrigerated 0.5 L brown bottle poured into a weizen glass. Pours cloudy golden with medium white. Aroma is estery, medium body, well carbonated, and good small bubble lacing. Taste is tangy clove, yeasty, and some honey. Pretty good hefeweizen.

hazy golden-orange in colour with a creamy white head. The aroma is of yeast, bubble-gum, banana, pears and cloves. flavour of banana and citrus with slightly acidic finish with a hint of hops. 
A great wheat beer.

Bottle thanks to WillRunForBeer for hunting this down for me. Shared at mrebeks. Cloudy light orange pour with a pillow-y head that fades somewhat quickly. Banana pudding dominates the aroma with hints of clove and bubblegum. Tastes like creamy liquid bananas. Really tasty. Light clove in the finish. Delicious hefe.

Courtesy of umich03jm
Bottle: The aroma consists of banana, citrus, clove, and faint bubblegum. It pours a hazy golden-orange with a one finger white head that fades to a thin film outlined by a soapy ring. The flavor starts with moderate banana and lighter citrus. Theres a touch of bubblegum the middle. The finish has clove and light wheaty notes. Its light-medium bodied with light-moderate carbonation.

Bottle. Moderate to heavy malt aromas of grain and straw, herbs for the hops, dough for the yeast, with notes of banana, bubble gum, ripe pear, and faint nutmeg and clove. Head is small to average in size, creamy, white, with good slippery lacing, and is mostly lasting. Color is murky, medium yellow amber. flavor starts lightly sweet and acidic, then finishes lightly sweet and acidic and lightly to moderately bitter. Palate is medium, creamy with a lively carbonation. Stronger and well balanced aromas and flavors in this German Hefeweizen sets it apart from other top beers of the style.
(bottle) cloudy orange amber colour with a medium tall white head; aroma of spice, bananas; slighlty thick palate; clean, balanced flavour

500ml bottle [Hard to reach the (actually) 6:0 demand of the German Football team with six Weizen(s) at this historic evening, seven just in this moment]. Hazy golden colour with huge, frothy, fairly lasting, white head. Wheaty and yeasty aroma, fruity hints of apple and clove. Taste is wheaty, yeasty, fruity notes of pear, apple, a touch of banana, clove; creamy texture close to a Weizenbock. Very nice.

Bottle, yellow - orange colour, huge head. 
Taste banana, citrus, really refreshing and light.
Bottle. Milky yellow pour with a white head. Lemon zest and yeast aromas. Lemon zest dominates with biscuit back beats. Good body and mouthfeel. Citrus undercurrents.

500ml bottle. Hazy orange color. Small size, white head, stays. Faint banana, wheat and sweet notes in aroma. Mild banana, fruity, grainy, wheat in taste. Soft carbonation. Thin grainy body. Nice one.
500ml bottle. Hazy straw color with white head. Clove aroma. Banana and clove taste. Great beer.
Bottle. Hazy gold with a fluffy white head. Aroma is wheat, citrus and floral notes. Taste follows suit but adds a nice banana note. Good crisp mouthfeel. Really nice.

UPDATED: JUN 8, 2014 Bottle 500ml at Restaurant Rattstube, Rudenheim am Rhein, Hesse. Hazy gold with white head. This proved to have quite a fresh taste, lemony, hints of spice and fruitiness, not to much of the weissbier character, which is a good thing for me. Likeable.

Keg at Kings Arms. It pours hazy golden with a medium white head. The nose is fresh, spicy, clove, banana bread, doughy and hay. The taste is smooth, banana, orange peel, clove rock, toast, hay and dough with a dry, citric finish. Medium body and average carbonation. Well-rounded classic weissbier action.

Draft at Dutchs. Pours a hazy golden color with a small white head. The aroma and flavor have pale wheat malts, banana, mild cloves and spices, light citrus, vanilla, very tasty and solid for the style.
Cloudy golden colour. Typical clove and banana aroma and taste. A nice hefeweizen.

on tap @ Dutchs / Cincinnati OH --- Cloudy dirty golden amber, a head that quickly drops to the rim, dots of lace. Taste is wheat malt going in that blooms in the palate, changing to spice, especially coriander, in the palate, which moves to an assertive brief finish. A solid beer, but a little heavy for the style, and not as good blending with food as most hefeweizens.

Draft to taster at Dutchs. Looks good for the style; a cloudy lemon orange with white lacing. Smells solid; a nice balance of hefe yeast, banana, wheat, and mild clove and citrus. Tastes like it smells with a pleasant mouthfeel. Not my favorite style, but a great example of it that was refreshing to come across.
Cloudy yellow color, with a big white persistent head. Smell of banana, melon and clove. The taste is very fruity, more intense than the typical Weissbiers, and a very sweet finish, with honey notes.

On tap at Dutchs. Great bready wheat hefe flavor! Very nice biscuity bready wheat, as well as some banana, vanilla, banana bread, light spice. Pours a hazy kind of pale orange golden color. Thin off-white head. Leaves dots and ropes of lace. Medium body. Good smooth lightly soft lighter carbonation. Easy drinking. Moderate sweet, light spicy taste. Nice light bitterness. Hint of orange citrus in here. Lightly dry finish. Its clear why this is so highly rated. Definitely an outstanding hefeweizen.

Hazy, whiteorange.
Aroma has cloves, spicies.
Flavor has same, little sour, yeasty.
The taste us similar to local brew in Freuburg cleaner than most hefe in this category a little light in carbonation does disappear quickly though easy to drink

Bottle; Pour is cloudy medium gold with a frothy white head into this weiss glass - retention is average here , light lacing presence - The nose I find to be the highlight here - citrus, grassy undertones, that move to light banana, spicey notes are present - in fact, for the style - the nose i fantastic. The flavor profile lacks the depth that the nose presents, but its nice overall - it is yeasty , perhaps overly so - citrus and banana initial , but modest, moving to a bittering note that moves to spicey elements, light candied sugar , but the center is what lacks perhaps the nuance that I recall from weihenstephan. Anyway - a nice example of the style!

A perfect example of the style, full of the flavor profile you would expect from a hefe. Very nice.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottled. Slightly hazy yellow pour. Esters bananas and cloves. A pretry archetypical hefe.

500ml bottle from Gourmondo.de, large white frothy fully lasting head, hazy yellow colour, good lacing. Heavily malty fruity aroma of Grain, banana and melon and chives, light floral hops and yeast. Taste is initially moderately sweet, lightly bitter and acidic with a slightly savory hint, turning into a bittersweet finish with an acetic feel. Full body, oily texture, soft carbonation. Quite a pleasant and very fruity weizen, certainly recommendable to those who like them really fruity,
Banana tart nose. Creamy banana flavor, marshmallow, orange zest, sour finish. A very solid weizen, rich and fruity flavors, an instant classic.

Autant le dire tout de suite : jaime pas la blanche. Mais rendons à César : ce produit est vraiment pas mal ! Une belle robe, une rondeur bien maîtrisée et un goût de fruit (banane en loccurrence) qui ajoute la touche "magique".

Lightly citrusy tartness, mild sweet banana, spice notes of clove, an extremely well-balanced Hefeweizen, amongst the best, though the flavors are perhaps not as intense as they could be it is a perfect summer drinker.
UPDATED: DEC 18, 2015 Aroma of wheat, yeast, banana. Flavour is similar. One of the best Hefeweizens Ive had, its quite tasty.

Das Bier beginnt mild-weich, schöne Bananen- und Nelkenaromen breiten sich zum Hauptteil aus, toll weiche Hefigkeit. Der Hauptteil ansonsten ist vollmundig-weich, mild, zum Ende hin leicht herb werdend. Sehr tief gehend und vollmundig. Der Nachgeschmack ist lang, leicht herb und schön bananig-nelkig-hefig. Rund und leicht süßlich. Sehr leckeres Weizen! --> 13/12/14/13
0.5 l draught @ Nürnberg. Refreshing hefeweizen with all the looks and taste of a decent product.

Old (and pretty shoddy) notes. Had twice Oct 2011. Hazy orange yellow, decent white head. Taste is a little watery for the style - light sweet flavour with typical qualities of wheat beer. Not a memorable wheat beer but enjoyable in the sun.

UPDATED: APR 10, 2014 shelf beer. a whole lot better than kbs. fun banana clove hefeweizen nose reminicent of weihenstephaner hefeweizenbier, but with an extra earthy, old wet woodsy, soft smoke. soft, mellow, banana cream pie. lifts just fine.

UPDATED: JUL 17, 2014 Bottle from Gourmondo. Hazy pale yrllow beer, thick white head. Sweetish fruity aroma. Fresh flavour is a bit citric with wheat and not so much banana or yeast. Very tasty thirst quencher.-- rated with beerbasher/Lumia 1020

Those who like their hefes with more emphasis on cloves than bananas are in for a treat w/ this one. I am kind of a juicy banana guy myself (and agree w/ all that implies) but can appreciate this for what it is. It pours a very cloudy orange color. The head is not really big or long lasting which is disappointing for the style though. As I said, this is heavy on the cloves but not overbearing. The nose is pretty mild but the flavor really comes out once its tasted. There is a great deal of fine-bubbled carbonation which lends a nice creamy texture as well. Banana notes start to shine only in the finish and linger w/ a touch of sweetness on the tongue. This is a well made beer. It is not completely in tune w/ my personal tastes but I am enjoying it quite a bit anyway.

500 ml bottle. Did a comparison with 3 other top rated hefes and liked this one best. Pours cloudy orange with reasonably dense and mostly lasting white head.
Aroma is strong banana, sweet, cloves and some bubble gum.
Tastes sweet similar to aroma and slightly acidic, creamy medium bodied with lively long lasting carbonation. Great stuff.
From bottle. Pours a hazy yellow. Banana, some yeast. A little spice.Taste has some dandelion green bitterness, forward wheat, but not like cereals. Lemon zest and cloves.

Very tasty Weissbier. I had visited Andechs a few years ago and really enjoyed the beer I had in their biergarten. The bottle pouts a nice cloudy yellow with a small white head. It has a light wheat taste and goes down smooth. Delicious beer.

Bottle sample at a tasting at Dancing Camel. Thanks Yoav. Pours an hazy fruit salad like with a small head, aroma of yeast, pepper, wheat, apples and clove, flavor of apple, clove, banana, phenol, pepper, medium bodied

500 mml tasted on 11/03/2014. Clear yellow colour with small white head. Aroma of Banana, Melon and Vainille. The taste is banana predominated . Nice carbonation. Light body. The taste and the palate is super!!! Next one please!!!

Bottle, says L0313 on it. Must be batch 3 of 2013? Who knows, anyways, quite fresh.Gushing! Though Im able to get it in to the glass without any spillage. Hazy, deep copper-orange body with a rather small, weakly retained white head that hangs around a covering.Cookies, clove and bubble gum in the nose, with a lighter banana note than most hefes (fine with me). Quite a good strength to it though, with no alcohol or off-notes. Some creamy, nutty wheat and no acidity or sourness.Soft, wheat-like palate and a bit of citrus-like acidity. Vanilla, honey and spicy clove mixed with hops on the finish. Banana and vanilla iced cream are delicious and surprisingly not too sweet (with the spiciness helping to balance). Quite light bodied, even for the style with some wateriness.At first, I was pretty unimpressed. Not that its bad or anything, just a little plain. I like the lack of banana here (still there, just light). Dosent seem much like the doppelbock or volbier, however. None of the classy yeast character those had (which makes sense since those are obviously not fermented with weisse yeasts).

Draft at Brouwers. Thanks to Ken for pointing this out to me. I get so set in my ways I often dont pay any attention to the Germans on the menu. Anyway ... Pours cloudy yellow-gold with a pillow of white head. Banana, clove, some pepper, all nicely balanced with one another. Nice caramelized sugar sweetness with a hint of lemon zest. Light body; refreshing. One heck of a nice beer all around.
very great wheat beer, would love to try the version not marked hell :)

500 ml bottle. Pours a cloudy yellow/orange; nice head, white and cushiony. Nose is citrus,banana. Taste is really nice - slightly sour, with the beer itself medium in body/carbonation, and simply refreshing. Looking forward to the other Anderch beers.
500 ml bottle. Pours cloudy dark orange with a high white head. Wonderful fruity wheat aroma. Great full bodied taste and slightly sour palate. One of the best existing wheat beers.
Huge white head. Cloudy yellow-orange colour. Wonderfully wheat aroma with notes of banana and vanilla. Fruity taste and a lasting sparkly palate. A perfect wheat beer.

This is such a perfect example of a traditional German Helles. The Klosterbrauerei Andechs continues to make amazing beer. Im so glad its accessible in the states via bottles now. No US brewery makes a German style beer anywhere near as good. Mmmm...
Trübes goldgelbes Bier mit schöner Schaumkrone. Geruch hefig, fruchtig. Geschmack hefig, fruchtig nach Banane, leicht würzig.

Bottle 500 ml at home as Weissbier Hell, thanks to McTapps! Into a weizen glass, ABV 5.5%
Bright golden orange colour on the body, quite hazy, with almost three fingers of thick white head on top. Very good retention, medium lacing left on the glass.
Aroma of unripe bananas, grass, flowers. 
Nice taste, clean, also bananas and a bit floral, light yeast and clove after I poured the last of it.
Medium body with good carbonation.
Overall pretty good, refreshing and clean and great thirst quencher.
Poured from bottle. Excellent representation of the class. Will definitely drink again.
Bottle, 500 ml at Aufsturz, Berlin. Pours hazy orange, fruity banana aroma. Wheat, spices, fruit flavor. Refreshing. Very good Hefeweizen.

Smells great. Bubblegum and banana. Amazing colour - cloudy pale yellowy with a white fluffy head - stays till the end. Good carbonation. Tastes lovely. A great hefeweizen. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle sample at a tasting at Dancing Camel. Thanks Yoav. Cloudy yellow with white film. Classy aroma - banana and clove. Yeasty bittersweet taste. Medium-to-full body, slightly dried banana finish. Good.

Bottle from Bottle Barn in Santa Rosa, CA. Labeled Andechs Weissbier Hell (at 5.5%). Label color matches photo. Pours dirty/hazy gold with a creamy white head. Aroma of banana ester and mild clove. Med body with lots of foam. Flavor is banana, melon, very light clove. Some wheat is present. Pretty good version of the style.
Bottle: Hazy yellow to light orange color with a creamy white head. Aroma is fruity with mainly banana. Flavor is also fruity with banana, yeast and wheat. Also light spicy.

On draught at Prost! Murky yellow golden color. Aroma is apricot, banana, and clove. Taste is apricot, banana, and light spicing. The mouthfeel is very light, with a refreshing fruit aftertaste balanced with a slight hop bitterness.

At a tasting, many thanks, thick pour almost like a fruit compote, lsmallish head, hazy apricot orange colour, aroma of bubblegum and tooth paste with some banana, flavour of banana, almonds with some wheat and spice, light pleasant sourness. Good classic weizen.

Bottle 0.5. Color - pale yellow, turbid. Foam - a very fine-grained, 2-3 finger, very resistant and sticks to the walls of glass. Fragrance - peel, fruit, citrus, clove, mandarin, lemon. Taste - creamy and lemon, soft indistinct bitterness. In sour aftertaste. Carbonation moderate.
nice weath aroma,light amber, hazy, white foam, light sweetness, lightly bitter, medium body, oily feel, soft carbonation, nice harmonic weath finish.
Golden coloured and hazy. Has a white head, medium duration. Sweet, soft aroma, notes of yeast. Flavor starts sweet, nice malty sugar notes, light bread, faint berries. Creamy texture.

500 ml. bottle from Perrys Liquors. It pours a somewhat clear orange color with a decent white head. The aroma is very nice with strong wheat, minor clove and a bit of bubble gum sweetness, but only a touch. Nice full mouthfeel and a prickly, spicy, lively finish. Well balanced.

Bottle @ The BeerMongers... Poured hazy, pale-yellow with a moderate head. Nose had some yeast notes and grassy character. Wheated tones along with some sweetness and mild light fruits. Hint of banana but not too heavy in that "Bavarian" character youd expect in a German wheat beer. Still, a good drinkable beer.

A bit of a cloudy beer that was not an instant hit but it sorts of grows on you with each sip. Incredibly gassy and frothy upon opening despite standing still for a few weeks but once exposed to the air it soon settles down. Taste is reasonably good and slightly bitter or tarty which suits my taste buds. No special memorable flavours stay on the palate but equally it is not offensive. A bit of an acquired taste for many but it does make a change from the filtered similar lookalike breweries that hang on the coT tails of quality German brewing. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Cloudy yellow-orange with a large foamy white head. Clove/bubblegum nose. Flavor has lots of clove with a long spice finish. Light to medium bodied and aggressively carbonated.

Yeasty aroma that is heavy with citrus and moderate with banana. Cloudy yellow appearance and visibly effervescent. Classic hefe look. Ringing bitter-tart flavor, really stands out here. Crispy crunchy wheaty body. A great hefe and at a good price. Imported by S & H Independent, Boulder.
Bottle 0.5l at home. Originally rated 18.8.2012. Colour is cloudy light orange with small white head. Aromas and flavours: Fruits, bananas, wheat, yeast and malts.
Dunkel Gulbrun farge. Duft av malt og hvete. Tykt dekkende skum. Frisk smak av hvete. Lettdrukket.

Bottle poured a golden in color with an initial two finger head and such heavy carbonation it was swirling through the beer and continued to push the head higher as it sat. Beautiful in the glass. Aroma has wheat, yeast, banana, mild spices, and some light grains. Mouth feel is medium and there is loads of carbonation. Flavor is very clean, wheat, clove, banana, yeast, and a touch of grainy bitterness.

Spuytin Duyvil, Brooklyn tap ($8): I was surprised to see this on tap in the U.S., but reading the reviews, it certainly sounds like it was this. Anyway, it pours a cloudy light orange with a white head. Aroma is a lot of bananas and some cloves. Taste is banana, spice, citrus. Nice and fruity weisse bier. This is what other hefes want to be when they grow up.

Draft at The Great British Beer Festival 2013. Poured a cloudy light orange colour with a big, fluffy white head. Full aroma of bananas, cloves and other spices. Citrus and juicy fruit flavours with yeasty notes. Pleasant and balanced palate of wheat, dry grains and grass with lingering fruity sweetness. A fantastic example of the style.

Bottle. Very faint aroma of yeast and flour. Yellow-light brown and foggy head is medium big, thick and white. 

Taste has yeast, some citrus, banana. Bit watery on the aftertaste. Bitter finish. Very smooth, easy to drink yet some character.
Vom Fass. Graininess in the malt. low banana esters, low clove as well. creamy mouthfeel. Low carbonation in general. Best hefe yet though.
Very cloudy golden colour. a yeasty, citric aroma. Crisp, citric taste. with bannana and yeast. Really nice, refreshing drink
Cask at GBBF 2013. Cloudy bright orange long lasting white fluffy head. Rich clove and banana aroma some chalk. Bready malt crisp finish banana bread. This is a proper Weiss beer. Very tasty.
hazy, amber with a tall, fine head. nice aroma of banana, clove and herbs. well-belanced taste. pleasantly strong carbonisation. very refreshing.
Deliciously refreshingly bananary sprightly suppingly sumptiously smoothly yes

Good hefetrub, not sure about the banana aroma and a bit too sickly sweet and stocky. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
UPDATED: AUG 2, 2013 Hazy yellow body and a large creamy head that lasts. Aroma of malt, banana, yeast. The taxure is thin and oily. The taste is medium sweet and light bitter. Refreshing and nice.

Great golden colour with that yeast cloudiness and a fluffy white head. Aromas of Juicy Fruit (the banana flavour), cloves, and a light whiff of overnight cassoulet. Great flavour of Hefeweizen, the same shopping list, quite well balanced. Feels perfect.
Banana, herbs, yeast...super tasty summer weisse. I love its body and head. Very refreshing.

0,5 l bottle BB 19. Mar 14 
golden, cloudy, frothy, white foam, barnyard, bread, cereal, citrus, herbs, banana, medium sweetness, medium body, oily feel, creamy, slick feel, soft carbonation,

On tap at PIB, pours a cloudy golden with a small white head. Aroma of banana, clove, and wheat. Flavour brings out dry, tart wheat, banana and clove - very typical of a hef. Very nice balance of banana and clove. High drinkable and thirst-quenching. Solid stuff.

Flaske i solskinnet på fortauet udenfor Cafe Svejk, juli-13: ah, livet bliver knapt bedre - nellik, litt syre og banan, god munnfylde og et cremeskum som varer. Det gør smagen også, og med et gratiseksemplar af Politiken foran meg bliver sommerdager i København ret magisk. Alt peger mod bedre tider, forbrugertilliden og boligpriserne stiger. Den årelange krise er for alvor på retræte, leser jeg inden jeg igen setter mig på cykelen.

not very banana in nose, more clove/spiciness. delicious. a slight sour tang. solid body -- this is a wheat BEER! appropriately hazy amber gold color with a rich white rocky head. you need not drink any other german hefeweizenbier. this is it.

Originally had this on tap at the kloster, but I bought a bottle afterward to confirm my suspicions - this is the best Hefeweizen Ive ever had. Pours bright, hazy gold with a pillowy white head and nice lacing. Aroma is of lemon peel, yeast, fruity esters, slight banana, clove, and bubblegum. Taste is fairly dry, very crisp, and the wheat is distinct. Totally appropriate carbonation and body. Worth the hike.
Has everything you want and expect in a hefeweizen. Sweet banana, darkish body. Lots of flavour. Refreshing. On tap at Andechser beer garden in Wiesbaden.
Cloudy golden appearance with plenty of sedimentation. Inviting yeast aroma with hints of smoke. Rounded bready taste, one of the best examples of this beer style.
Hazy orange color with a very nice fluffy head. Aroma ist sweet and fruit, hints of banana. Flavor is most banana with a citrus and slight hop end. Mouthfeel is refreshing.

UPDATED: APR 2, 2017 Bottle from Cork & Cask. Hazy orange body with a thick white head. Lively carbonation. Good lacing. Aroma of chalk dust, red apple and yeast. Flavour of tangy lime, orange and white pepper. Medium body with a frothy texture. Soft fizz. Fruity and moreish.

0.5l bottle. Hazy orange body, white head. Very smooth aroma with mostly banana, but it has some bubble gum, bread and lemon zest notes too. Tastes like banana, lemon zest and bread with a nice floral hop kick in the end of the sip. Medium body, decent carbonation. Awesome weizen.
Colour of yolk with white head. Citrus and wheat in the aroma, a bit of tropical fruits, some bread and cookies. The taste is a bit watery, flour, wheat, nothing special.

50cl bottle, served in Weizen. Pours foggy orange-yellow with medium white frothy head. Wheat , bubblegum, hints of banana and spice on the nose. Predominantly banana-like concerning taste, some cereals, and a slight touch of hops in the back (subtle). Not too dry or sweet, very well balanced. Medium body, perfect carbonation. A really pleasant Hefeweizen.
270413. Bottle at home. Pours hazy yellow with a nice head. Aroma banana, wheat. Slightly sweet body. Very nice hefeweizen. Not Bad.
Clear yellow with lasting big snow white foam head, lacing. Aroma is citrus, with some floral. Bjit weak taste, a Weissen. Short aftertaste, not a bad beer on a warmer spring day. (Velp 201304)

Shared with Azlondon in Andechser am Dom 6.4.2013.
0,3 from tap. Yellow, hazy with a large white head. Wheat, spices and malt aroma. Quite bitter taste with a lond wheaty end.

50cl bottle pours with an opaque pale gold body that exhibits copper hues and supports a nearly bright white head of foam. The aroma is fully banana and clove and yeasty and a touch of pepper. The taste is both smooth and prickly with splashes of refreshment. I get a rush of carbonation that pushes banana notes right up and then over the water fall of flavor. Around the edge eddies are notes of spicy cloves and a faint yeastiness. From time to time I also get micro second flashes of lemon as well. Cool stuff.

I really liked this one. Has a very grassy barnyard smell. Taste follows the smell with notes of yeast vanilla something like star anis. Body is not so typical for a hefe it was quite full. Anyhow i found the Andechs hefeweizen interesting and refreshing.

On tap at the brewery. Pours a cloudy, orange-gold colored body with a two inch thick, dense, creamy and foamy, white head that dissipates slowly and leaves a nice lacing throughout. Aroma is big banana with a nice malt sweetness. Some wheats, a light clove, a soft yeast note, and a few citrus hints. Flavor is similar. Lightly sweetened malts with a nice wheat note, smooth banana, a light clove spice with some phenols, soft yeast notes, and a light orange peel citrus towards the end. Finishes clean, lightly sweetened, fruity, and lightly spiced before leaving a fairly lengthy aftertaste. Medium, smooth body and a soft, somewhat lively, medium-high carbonation. Overall, a really nice German Hefe. Lightly sweetened and more towards the banana esters, but still some phenols and a light yeasty spice to provide a solid balance. Good one.

Shared with Nordcore in Andechser am Dom.
Appearance: Hazy pale yellow. Lots of white head.
Aroma: Wheat, citrus. Some yeast as well.
Taste: Citrus, wheat, smooth. Hops? Nice.
Info: 300ml draught, 6/4-2013

Aroma fruttato (banana, pera), di bubblegum. Nel bicchiere si presenta classicamente torbida con quel bel cappello di schiuma che ti mette di buon umore. Al palato corposa, densa fruttata. Finale aromatico. Decisamente equilibrata, forse un pò meno piena della Ayinger Weiss ma ugualmente buona e beverina.

Pours cloudy orange with a large white head. Smells sweet, banana, clove, and wheat. Taste is sweet, lightly fruity, hints of spice. Medium-bodied with a smooth texture and mild mouth-carbonation, Andechser Weissbier Hefetrüb finishes with subtle sweetness.

Hazy golden yellow color with a large white head. Aroma is banana, citrus, and hop. Flavor is banana, citrus, wheat and yeast. Moderate sweet and a bit bitter with a average to long duration. Would be a perfect summerbeer.
Pours hazy orange with a nice white head. Nice banana, wheaty aroma with some notes of yeast. Flavour is sweet, fruity bananas with a nice hint of bitterness. Very refreshing, a great Hefe!

Bottle 0,50L. Cloudy orange colour with average big creamy white head. Strong aroma of banana and chewing gum dominates, but there are also some white bread, herbs and citruses signs. Taste is light sweet with moderate bitter aftertaste. Full bodied, creamy beer with soft carbonation. Somehow light and easy to drink, not heavy as some hefeweizens are. Very well balanced.

appearance: Light yellow, bit hazy, good firm foamy top. 

smell: The usual white bear smell, banana, bread-like, but weak in smell. 

taste: Like the smell suggest a bit of a weak, yet refreshing, flavor. Its almost like a light beer. Bit of bread and banana, with a tad of citrus freshness. 

mouthfeel: Fresh and light. Quite some carbonation going on.

overall: Its a nice bear, but nothing really special. Just a nice refreshing summer white bear, but i know quite a few better ones.

Cloudy yellow with a good white head.
Aroma is wheat and yeast. In mouth it feels like a young weizen.
In mouth more wheat and yeast. Its like drinking a really nice weizen in the brewery.
Carbonation is perfect.

500ml bottle. pours a bright, golden, cloudy yellow. aroma is very strongly of citrus fruits and hops. floral too. taste is full on wheat with lemons and slightly flowery. taste lasts and is not over-carbonated. very nice.

UPDATED: APR 23, 2013 Nice white head and hazy orange/yellow colour. Smells little spicey and maybe orange. Taste is sweet/sout, well balanced, with evident wheat taste. Very dry finish. Its different than most of weizen, because I didt taste the banana note, not really, but maybe also for this is a very interesting and particular weizen. The finish is very dry. Carbonation is perfect. Very good beer.

Bottle. Pours hazy light amber with hazy white head. Distinct flowery, yeasty and hoppy aroma. Soursweetish flavour of grain and yeast. Pleasant, really balanced. Good, mildly dry aftertaste. A very good hefeweizen.

En botella cortesia de beerbox. Color y espuma caracteristico de una weiss. Aromas bien definidos ,intensos y mas complejos sin olvidar la banana y especias. Sabor equilibrado,poco dulce y mas amargo de lo que seria una weiss.recomendable!

Bottle shared by Thorpe429. Thanks Mike!

The appearance is typical of the style. Straw yellow in color with a dense, white head. Fantastic aroma with banana, clove, spices, wheat. Refreshing flavor. Light and soft on the palate. Poundable. Superb balance. I would love to try this side by side with Weihenstephaner Hefeweissbier, as these are without question the two best examples of a German hefeweizen I have ever had. Highly recommended.

Cloudy golden orange pour with a white head. Huge clove and banana aromas to this. Nice malty sweetness of bread, wheat, and a hint of citrus zest. The banana and clove characteristics are just as strong on the palate. Great malt sweetness, mild grass, tons of wheat bread, and some yeast to the beer as well.

On tap at Andechser am dom in Munich.Pours Hazy honey gold with a puffy white head.Aroma of Banana,honey and bubblegum.Notes of Ripe banana,sweet malt,vanilla,walnuts,butterscotch,yeast,sweet fruit and spice.

500 ml Flasche; fruchtiger, hefiger und leicht weiziger Geruch. Schöne hell-gelbe Farbe, trübe Erscheinung mit einem nur kleinen Kopf. Geschmacklich sehr ausgeglichen. Fein hefig, fruchtig (Banane und Birne) und eine leichte Weizennote.

50cl bottle at Centimeter, Vienna. Pours hazy deep golden with a large white head. Aroma of banana, wheat and yeast. Sweet and fruity with a nice banana flavour. Delicious beer on a hot summer day. Very refreshing. Nice hefeweizen! (2009-08-30)

8/VIII/2012 - on tap @ Andechs Kloster (Andechs) - BB: n/a - (2012-857) 
cloudy orange beer, big creamy white head, stable, bit adhesive. Aroma: some banana, sweet, bit herbal, vegetable soup, little sour touch. MF: lively carbon, medium to full body. Nice Hefe but hard to describe in a way it does honour to the beer.

Bottle. This one is more on the crispy sharp side of the hefeweizen spectrum. Nice, hazy golden colour with a frothy head. Fresh, tart, citrusy aroma with lots of cloves, balanced by vanilla, some breadiness and fruity notes of banana and pear. Taste is quite tart for a hefeweizen, definitely citrusy. Lots of cloves as well and the bitterness is above average in terms of intensivity. Yeasty aftertaste. Very good, comes across quite aggressive but it works very well.
Its an atypical German hefe. Light yeasty, wheaty taste with banana sweetness.
Quite a nice beer! Quite well carbonated, feels lighter than counterparts yet yeastier. Golden body, thick white head. Strong banana characteristics with mango like taste!
Thick unfiltered traditional hefeweizen. Nice taste but a bit too heavy an not refreshing
Very cloudy dingy gold. This is a nice hefe. Cloves, banana, nice fruit, It is mildly bitter and has a bit of spice.
2012 - 07 - 17 500ml bottle.hazy light orange colour. medium, white head. hint of banana in aroma. light sweet taste.

(Bottle)  - Very hazy orange-gold. Pours a thick white head that quickly diminishes to a thin, but persisting head. Med carb. A light wheat beer aroma; light yeasty fruit aroma - bit of banana, slight spice, not too impressive. Typical wheat beer flavours, bit fruity, bit spicy, though lacking on bitterness - the yeasty, aromatic fruit flavours dominate, with little hop flavour coming through. Initially it is slightly acidic, but then quickly turns softer, with a slightly buttery body. Bit of a watery palate and the flavours taste similarly diluted. Some spicy fruity flavours are left afterwards. Overall, a decent, but not outstanding wheat beer.

Tap @ Andechs am Dom, Munich. Nice glowing orange appearance with a fluffy white head. Nice banana, good clove, a little spicy aroma. Quite nice citrusy, delicious banana, clove, somewhat spicy wheat flavor. Really a nice Hefeweizen.

Bottle.  Hazy orange pour with a large white head.  Aroma is banana, wheat and yeast.  Fairly sweet flavour of banana, other fruit, sweet malt and caramel, light bitter.  Light to medium bodied with high carbonation.

50cl bottle. Hazy pale golden colour with a white head, large with a decent duration. Aroma is citrus and green wheat, notes of cinnamon and banana are present. Flavour is buttery, with notes of lemon, melon and banana, also cinnamon. The final is fruity with a good duration and slightly sweet. Creamy on palate. Carbonation is medium. Body is low to medium.
Hazy golden beer with thick head. Smells like wheat and corn, taste of fruits, banana and yeast. Very pleasant bitterness in the finish. A very nice beer.

UPDATED: MAY 21, 2012 500ml bottle. Aroma is very fruity (slightly banana), yeast. Appearance is cloudy orange with a hughe white head. Taste is citrus and sweet. A very nice mouthfeel with a long sweet finish. Overall one of the best Hefeweizen I know.

This beer came last in a blind tasting of 4 German brewed Hefewiezrn biers held at my place last week (Sep 2008). It was up against biers from Krombacher (the best), Erdinger and Schofferhofer.

Typical murky, clouldy yellow body you come to expect of a Hefewiezen, good light head that hangs around for most of the drink.

There was a lot of vanilla and banana in the aroma, but not much spice or citrus to be found.

The taste was again average, not as spritzy, tangy or crisp as the other biers in the tasting, almost bland in some aspects.

I know this beer seems to get high scores from most reviewers, but it did very little to get many votes when compared to the others mentioned. A big dissapointment all round for me.

Cloudy yellow/orange with a fluffy light tan head.  Beautiful yeast, fresh wheat, with orange, lemon, a hint of clove, and banana in the aroma.  Most interesting for me is the abundant pear bubblegum note.  Lightly sweet, but has a faint lemon tartness to balance everything perfectly.  Medium light body, active but creamy carb, with just a whisper of hop bitterness in the finish.  Fantastic, old-school, German hefe.  Definitely one of my favorites.

Draft. Classic hazy golden orange color with a big white head. The nose is predictable - banana, clove, spring water and light fruits. The taste is standard hefeweizen. More banana, rainwater, wheat. The body is light and easy. Prickly carbonation. Quite decent, uncontroversial.

Bottle. Pours a hazy, light golden colour with a beautifull, white head that buidls above the rim of the glass. Awesome. Good carbonation going on in the glass. Aroma of banana and vanilla and little bit of citrus too. Not as much as a witbier, but I think I did detect something. Flavour is light on the palate, refreshing and easy drinkable. Quite sweet, but subtle and really bringing the wheat forward. Well balanced and a good hefe weizen.

50cl bottle, 5.5%, 1.50 one week past best before date. Light orange colour, of course cloudy. Nice compact white head. Strong weissbier smell. Classic hefeweizen: fruity and citrusy with some spicy notes and a consistent sweet malts backbone with yeast. A correct bitterness in the finish too. Taste is balanced and crisp. Light to medium body, low carbonation, dry finish. Clean and refreshing, somewhat crude and keller, good weizen.
On tap at Andescher Dom in Munich. A real fruitful and refreshing hefe from the Andescher sortiment.

Pours deep orange cloudy muddy. with white rocky head. Aroma is bananas, citrus and some grass, rather weak smell overall. Palate is slick, oily, mouthful and little tart. Carbonation is mouthful, soft and smooth. Taste is sweetish, wheat malty, yeasty, with hints of floral hops and dryness. Finish is medium dry, with sweet wheat malts and fruity with plums. Overall a rather average Hefeweizen, balance is not the top. Still drinkable.
Andecher am Dom, presumably draft. Murky yellow-golden body, thick creamy white head. Light nose, dry banana, glue and cloves. Yeah, dry taste too, banana & glue. Not bad.
Orange colour and citrus flavours with a blunt slightly chemical lenghty grip.  Lots of bubblegum and bananas, but seems a little synthetic.
UPDATED: MAY 29, 2014 Bottle from Bierzwerg. Blond hazy color. Aroma is yeast and wheat. Taste is citrus, Yeast, strong banana, sweet. Long aftertaste. One of the best Hefes!
Bottle. Light orange with a large frothy head. Aroma is yeast and malt. Flavour is clean crisp citrus with banana caramel. Finish is dusty caramel with a dry palate.

Bottle 50cl. Quite pale cloudy brew, firm head, fresh yeasty smell. Wonderful refreshing and "süffig". Nice brew!

Bottle.  Pours hazy pale gold with a large, frothy white head, long retention with good lacing.  Aroma is heavy wheat malt, banana and clove, pepper, and earthy notes.  Flavor is malt dominant, light banana and spices with a dry finish.  Light body and warmth, medium carbonation.

Bottle courtesy of Trapissed via Vineyard, Belfast
Typical phenol and banana notes on the nose, hazy blonde with rounded mouthfeel and clean finish.

Bottle picked up from an overseas shop. Served in a SAVOR wine glass alongside the doppelbock.

Pours a cloudy yellow-straw color with a nice and fluffy white head. Good retention and lacing on the way down. The nose has heavy yeast character with nice banana and bubblegum notes, and a touch of clove in the background.

A light breadiness exists in the flavor, serving as the base for the yeast. Nice notes of bubblegum and banana throughout with a touch of spice to the finish. Light-medium body with slight chewiness and a silky finish. Really well made. Im glad I finally got to try this longtime want.
toast, barnyard, citrus, banana, amber, cloudy, white foam, rocky head, medium sweetness, very bitter, medium sourness, umami, full body, creamy, flat, long finish, bitter,
Hazy orange beer with a thick head. Grassy and orange-like aroma with powerfull wheat notes. The flavour is sweet with a salty finish. Very refreshing!

Hands down the best Hefe I ever tasted.  I am not a hefe fan, and as such, I think the lack of chemical and funky filmy wheat aftertaste and thickness on the tongue isnt there.  Its clean, refreshing, perfect in everyway to me.  I do like all of Andechs offering but this just gave me hope for hefes.  I love this beer.  Crafted well, applause for this one! overall if you like Hefe, classical, original brewing tactics and surity, this is for you .  If you love good beer this is for you.!!!!  Try it today.

Predictable banana sweetness, with a slightly sterile depth. Decent Hefe gradient with minor head to the end. Exceptionally well rounded palate without overpowering the Weiss elements. Keeps a lid on 5.5% with odd sweetshop highlights in the linger. One of the finest in its field. (Bottle, The Pond, Edinburgh)
Bottle. Cloudy lemon yellow. Familiar yeasty banana nose. Moderate carbonation and typical banana clove Hefe flavour. Delicious.

.5L bottle from Doodler. Thanks Scott! Nose is  banana, wheaty bread, and yeast. Murky yellow with a big, heavily lacing pale yellow head. Flavor is sweet ripe banana, cloves, white pepperiness, and a hint of bubblegum.
Cloudy yellow color with medium sized head. Fine wheat beer but do not stand out. To standard.

How: Bottle 500ml at Die Stube, Brasov, Romania
The look: Cloudy dark blonde body topped by a persistent small white head
In long: Nose of uber-fresh bananas.  Taste is fresh bananas, a bowl of fruit salad, peaches, fresh bakery white bread, yeast.  Very nice full and lively mouthfeel.  There is a lot of complexity in this beer compared to other examples of this usually simple style.  Nourishing, complex and refreshing.  Among the widely distributed german hefe this is definitely one of the best one, almost comparable to the Paulaner Hefe-Weissbier classic.  Very easy to drink.  Im telling you guys, I can drink 10 gallons of a beer like this in a single night ok, ok, maybe Im a compulsive liar but at least I have a very big penis.

Un ottima birra! Sicuramente la miglior Weisse! Un aroma eccezionale! Un colore carico, e un gusto ineccepibile! Altamente consigliata!

Bottle from Appellation Wines. Clove banana aroma. Cloudy yellow brown colour, big foamy head. Sharp spicy clove banana flavour. Aromatic bitter sweet aftertaste. A good hefe.

Golden orange color, big froathy white head. wheaty and yeasty, very subtle banana aroma and flavour, the domianting fruit is oranges. A quite good Hefe even if I am nto the biggest fan.

Aroma is sweetish with banana esthers, some wheat and hints of yeast. Somewhat tart and slightly acidic flavour is fresh with sweetish banana esthers and wheat. Slightly too much CO2 on palate. Good.

Sample at KØ-2011. Golden-orange colour with a white head. aroma is banana, orange, wheat. Flavour is banana, orange, wheat, spices. Nice beer.

When you think of German Hefes,  This is the example you are thinking of.  Smuggled this home from Germany and wish I had more.  Pours a cloudy golden yellow with a big frothy white top. On tap at GBBF 2011. Cloudy sparkling golden yellow with massive head. Orange, yeast and vanilla dominate the aroma with the banana and clove more in the background. Good spritzy mouthfeel with some actual hop evident in the finish. Excellent hefeweizen.

500 mL into a long glass at Andechser am Dom in Munich.  Orange cloudy beer with foamy head.   Nice wheatiness.  Very nice wheat beer.

En klassisk "mitt ivägen" weissbier. Sticker inte ut på något sätt men duger gott att dricka, speciellt en varm sommardag.

C: typicical hefeweizen colour. Hazy yellowish. The beer itself is just like most other hefe weizen beers. Its a good one though, but not my kind of beer.
Bottle from Super Brugsen Højby. Hazy orange colour with a huge white head. Aroma and flavour of yeast, orange, banana, spice and wheat.
