Durstlöschendes HW der angenehmen Sorte. Könnt ich wieder trinken.

500 ml bottle. Pours hazy golden yellow with thick, white head. Yeasty, yet fresh, wheat-like flavour with citric notes and some banana. Hint of sourness. Quite lively carbonated, but the palate is smooth nevertheless. A really nice Hefeweizen.
Cloudy yellow with a big white head. Aroma is sweet, wheaty, light banana, yeasty and citrus. Flavor is medium sweet and light bitter. Sweet and light citric finish. 080511

Flaske: Gulorange uklar øl med et kæmpe skumhoved. Klassisk Hefe. Duft af banan og en smule gær, hvilket jo næsten er det samme i dette tilfælde. Ikke så frisk i smagen som jeg havde ønsket mig og karboneringen er næsten ikke eksisterende. Ville have været bedre med en anelse mere.
Vom faß at the abbey, a solid Hefeweizen, not at the pinnacle, but packed with deliciousness.
Bottle 500ml. Color hazy golden with medium head.Aroma yeast, wheat, citrus, flower. Taste fresh, wheat, fruit, flower.

Bottle 50 cl. Hazy golden pour with a big white head, great length. Aroma and taste of yeast, wheat, corn and banana noet of coriander and citrus.
Balancing taste and aftertaste, however, felt a twinge pepper ultimately

Cloudy, yellow beer with a big and white head. Wheat, sourness, some bananas and spicyness in the aroma. Taste is also wheatish, some lemon and quite lot of sourness. Fresh, lot of carbonation, but it is smooth, nice to drink. Nice, fresh and sour hefe; simple, but it works greatly.
Tap. Aroma of yeast, wheat malt and a bit of citrus. Almost orange colour with softe white head. Excellent weissbeer flavour with plenty of wheat well balanced with yeast and fruit.

Bottle.  Pours a medium golden body with a white huge rocky head.  Aromatically spicy, flowers, pepper tones, cobwebs, light banana light bubble gum but i would not call it fruity.  Very dry body nice sharp spices, cloves, very yeasty a hint of birch light bubble gum.  This beer is absolutely alive and has a little bit of funkiness to the yeast character.  This is THE BEST hefeweizen ive had to date.  Outfuckingstanding.

Bottle from Asao. Big fragrant aroma of banana, clove, some citrus. Blalanced and nice. Deep cloudy gold-yellow with orange and a high, frothy head. Thick, rich wheat malt flavors, banana cream cake witha very nice tart edge that balances well. Rich and thick body. Spicy with some citrus. Excellent stuff.  One of the best.

Bottled from Bierzwerg. Cloudy golden color with nice thick white head. Aroma, yeasty, orange, spices, touch of banana. Taste, wheat, hints of citrus, some banana. Nice bittersweet finish. Drinkable beer.

50cl bottle from Bierzwerg. Poured hazy golden/yellow color with a huge frothy head. Aroma is banana, clove and weak yeasty notes. Flavor is wheat, banana and some spices. High carbonation. Very well in balance, excellent hefe, very refreshing and enjoyable.
Keltainen ja samea. Eittäin runsas ja paksu vaahto. Hyvä perushefe perinteisine vahvuuksineen. Hedelmäisyyttä ja vehnää.

arancio scarico e opaco buoni sapori di agrumilaschiuma bella fine che non finisce maiin bocca si presenta con una carbonazione forse un po piu leggera rispetto ad altre weizen (e per me va bene visto che di solito piu di una non ne bevo visto lalta frizzantezza)lieve acidita !buona birra da bere bere bere e ancora bere
Colore classico dello stile nel mio weizenglass, aroma fruttato. In bocca davvero rinfrescante, con buon finale.
bottle thanks to bu11zeye.  poured hazy yellow with a white head.  aroma was banana and bubblegum.  flavor was banana, bubblegum, and clay.  light body with medium carbonation.
27th June 2007  Warning! Early amateur rating! Smooth wheatbeer. Slightly fruity aromatic. Sweet finish. Good.

Draught at the monastery. Hazy gold with a bit frothy white head that has good retention. Lots of clove and banana and vanilla in the aroma. Bright fruitiness in the flavor with lots of clove, medium sweetness and a nice doughy wheat malt flavor. medium bodied with nice, ample carbonation. Nice weissbier with a nice vivid fruitiness in the aroma.

Bottle @ Frankfurt Airport, Germany. Light hazy orange with a cramy white head. Nose of banana, wheat, coriands. Taste is banana, wheat, massmallows, coriands, light lemonlike sourness finish. Medium body, creamy mouthfeel. Pretty good summer beer. 061210

Bottle. Cloudy orange, large white head. Aroma has vanilla, banana, lemon, cloves. Light bready texture. Sweet with a big sour wheaty and lemony tang. Mildly spicy dryish finish with cloves and coriander. Yes, its a warm night and maybe this bottle has travelled particularly well, but wow. Just sweet enough and then almost austere sourness and vibrant spices - very refreshing without seeming inconsequential.
500ml bottle.  Pours a very hazy lemon orange with a head that goes rapidly.  Aroma is lemon, wheat and a tiny bit of banana.  Lemon start.  Very dry, tart lemon finish with wheat on the aftertaste.

Bottle. Pours cloudy light orange with a big spongy white head. Aroma has notes of cloves and bread. Taste is wheaty with a slightly citrusy touch to it. Herbal and smooth mouthfeel.Pretty good weizen.
500 ml bottle a hazy light yellow colored beer with a white head aroma malts banana fruits some coriander and hops taste malts banana some spices and hops
(500ml bottle)  Pours a cloudy golden body with a medium dense white head.  Aroma of banana, wheat, and citrus.  Flavor of banana, lemon, some vanilla, and wheat.  A solid Hefeweizen.
Bottle 50cl. A cloudy yellow beer with nice head. This very creamy and perfumed weizen beer is nice and pleasant, good malty and cereal notes. Finish is dry with long hopy aftertaste.

Best before Late November, consumed in early October. Absolute perfection in the body and look. Hefe to a T - lasting dense white head atop a superbly golden body. No clear pour here, this thing was trüb all the way! Moderate clove and quite heavy banana in the aroma, classic and excellent. The flavor has that classic, slightly acidic combination of wheaty tang, bubblegum (and banana) sweetness, clove spice. Wow. Impressive hefe, really top class.
user_location: Łódż, Warsaw, Poland; Michigan, Ohio, USA

text: Bottle. Nice head with medium duration. Color is hazy golden. Aroma and taste are malt, yeast, hops and fruits. Nice hefe.

(.5L bottle best by 1-28-11 thanks to blutt59) cloudy yellow with a lasting film of white bubbles. Nose of coriander, wheat, corn and bubblegum. Taste of wheat, bubblegum, spicy clove, and a mild banana linger. Creamy body, with a dry finish. I guess I need to try this again, everyone else liked it more than me.
In the more banana range of the hefeweizen spectrum than tart. This one is quite good.  Yeasty goodness. Serving: Bottle

Thanks to blutt59 for sharing this bottle.

The beer pours a hazy yellow color with a white head. The aroma is strong bananas and cloves. The flavor is bananas, yeast and cloves. Medium, creamy mouthfeel and medium carbonation. This beer is exactly what I am looking for in a hefeweizen. Awesome.
thanks Blutt59! wheat, cloves, coriander, lemon, zesty.  very pleasant beer.
UPDATED: MAR 24, 2011 bottle, thanks to SS, cloudy gold color with creamy white foam, aroma of lots of clove and banana, flavors of bubble gum, cream of wheat, banana, spice, great beer

Bottle from KaDeWe in hotel.
Appearance : Hazy yellow with a big fluffy and creamy head.

Aroma : Lots of banana, some chewy and bready malts. Notes of spices.

Taste : Nice banana and wheat. Finish spicy with banana and wheat.

Overall : Pretty straight forward weisse. A well brewed straight forward weisse is always good in my book so I liked this one. Love the bananas...

UPDATED: AUG 17, 2010 Draft @ Wildeman. Hazy orange yellow pour, large creamy head.
Aroma is banana, citrus, spices.
Standard but nice hefe.

0,5 l bottle, bought at Sörspecialista.hu. Poured hazy, golden yellow with a respectable white foam that stays. Yeasty aroma with banana, apple, peach, grapes, very fruity in general. Sweet taste that is somewhat dry, well balanced one in a medium dense body and lively carbonation. 30 celsius outside, and one of these babies, what else can you ask for? Very nice one.

(Old BA rate - bottle)
Pours with a billowing pure white head that dies down pretty quickly and leaves a thin residual white head; deeply cloudy vibrant yellowy orange color. 

Getting loads of banana in the nose and it is quickly followed by sharper citrus aromas that are a touch sour; cloves and bubblegum-like flavors are definitely present as well.

Not quite the banana bomb as much as in the aroma, but still definitely the dominant flavor followed only by a pretty nice citrus burst and then has a more muted quality around the clove side of things, but its still there. Fluffy MF, yeasty, bubbly carbonation, really quite good over the palate. This brew is fantastic in drinkability terms, refreshing, tasty, has some nice interesting layers, and is everything a good hefe should be. Great stuff.

Bottle from bigbox meppen. Golden yellow hazy coloured, pours out with a big white head and lots of carbonation. Aroma is fine herbs and fruity, but not so much as some other weisses. Peaches, banana and herbs. Medium bodied,  somewhat bitter. very refreshening.

Pours lovely hazy golden with fluffy off white head. Heavy "hefe" yeasty, malty, smokey and fruity aroma. Fruity, smokey, crisp, malty and dry flavor. Acidy dry but still very full bodied on palate. Finish is a bit flat, dry hoppy with tones of fruity sweetness.

Bottle at home. Pours a hazy creamy orange to yellow color with a thin creamy white head. Aroma is a bit chemical bubblegum with banana. Lots of hefe in there. Flavor is quite bitter, slightly fruity and a bit sour. Nice, yet a bit bland. Quite refreshing and fruity after it warms up a bit. Creamy texture and lively carbonation. Decent brew.

On tap at Andechser am Dom in München summer 2009. Very golden colour with a nice white head that lasts. Fruity flavour with banana and citrus and leaves with a good sweet aftertaste. Easy to drink and suits well with the summer of course.

A - Hazy golden straw and orange lemon color with a large, pillowy, thick, creamy soapy white color head. Good retention settling into a nice creamy layer of lace.

S - A lot of malted wheat aroma. Some banana and clove, but not as much as other Hefeweizens. Fair amount of lemon and orange citrus. A lot of yeast aroma and some basic herbal/spice aroma.

T - Similar to the nose with a nice wheat and bready malt taste. Strong fruit flavor with golden peach and apricot fruit and some lemon and orange citrus. Slight tartness comes out later along wit a bit of mineral taste. Decent amount of yeast. Banana, clove, and bubblegum are all present, but not as strong as a number of Hefeweizens.

M - On the lighter side of medium body with a good amount of carbonation. Pretty smooth.

D - A very enjoyable beer that isnt quite as bold or strong as some other Hefeweizens. Very easy to drink beer, and I could definitely have another.

Notes: Best before 20/10/10. Overall this is a nice Hefeweizen. It isnt the best beer Ive had, but it is solid. Not quite as full or have the spice/fruitiness as most others in the style, but it is there. tasty beer that is worth trying.

Very strongly typed wheat beer.  This is a full-flavored hefe styled wheat beer.  Compare to the Schneider Hefe with a bit less thickness and more spice.  This is the quintessential summer wheat that American craft brewers cant ever seem to reproduce.  (maybe because they just add wheat to kolsch style ales...)

On draft at De Wildeman. Pale gold in colour with strong carbonation. Typical hefeweiss aromas of banana, vanilla, and a bit of clove. Similar profile in the mouth and medium bodied, but with a nice snappy mineral note on the finish. Very refreshing.
bottle. Cloudy golden colour, large white head. Fruity nose. Malty, wheaty and yeasty with a nice fruity touch and hints of bubblegum.

0,5 l bottle, bought at Sörspecialista.hu
Poured hazy golden with a fantastic foamy-creamy white head that never disappeares. I slip the beer from under the foam....Fine banana aroma with some caramel, fruits like fig and green-apple, some citrusses, mild spicies. Lively carbonation, medium body with weizen-yeast-flavor, fruity, phenolic banana and citrusses, mild green apple again, some sweet mellifluous malt. Balanced spicy taste. Classic one.

Bottle. Very yellow colour, cloudy, with a white head. Candy banana, cookie dough and some hops in aroma. Fruity taste, orange. Sweet cookie dough. Vanilla. Sweet. Some hops in the end. Quite big bodied for a hefe. Well made, but a little boring.

Bottle.

Pours golden orange and very hazy with a cramy head.

Spicy, wheat and yeast.

Appearance: Cloudy, messy golden color. Fluffy, somewhat diminishing white head sits on the top.

Aroma: Intense nutty, bready malt quality with definitely sweet vanilla and banana esters.

Flavor: Distinct vanilla sweetness fills the palate instantly and followed by some faint grainy, nutty malty notes. Peaked in a vivid clove and coriander spiciness.

Mouthfeel/Palate: Intense, prickling carbonation. Easy body with slightly watery feel. Rather spicy than fruity flavor profile.

Overall: Quite nice Hefe-wheat with a good sweet malty backbone and a nice crisp, spicy yeast quality.

Bottle from Beers of Europe. Cloudy gold pour with a fluffy white head. Aromas of orange peel, grapefruit, barley, pine. Flavours of lemon rind, grapefruit, tangerine. Very fruity. Citrus laden mouthfeel. Light hoppy finish. Very refreshing.

Milky golden pour, nice head retention. Im not really sure what to say about this one. Everything you look for in a good hefe is there,  but nothing really sets it apart. Its very nicely balanced, and is a great example of the style, but it doesnt have that little something that sets a brew like weihenstephaner apart on its own level. Very enjoyable though.

UPDATED: JUN 24, 2012 Golden yellow hazy body with pretty big soapy white head. Green bananas, corn flakes, candy peaches, light fresh yeast. Light sweet, easily drinkable. Very tasty base maltyness, light citric hint towards the end. Smooth carbonation. Perfectly brewed, rises just above the other German big guns. Drink cold. (50cl bottle, pretty cheap, re-rated)

Bottle 50 cl from Le Tonneau-Verre in Yverdon (CH).Blond pale and milky, fine crackling under a pur white and sticky foam. Nose of yeast, lemon, banana, a little smoked. The taste is sweet and creamy, fruity banana and peach, spicy and wheaty. Final drier, nervous, touch of refreshing acidity.

Bottle. Gift from Awesome Anker. Thanks buddy. Cloudy yellow with a thick fluffy white head. The aroma is banana, candy, fruit and citrus. Flavour is citrus, banana, clove and fruit. Very refreshing. Mild fruity and light spicy finish.
UPDATED: MAY 30, 2011 (500ml bottle) Proverbial banana and clove ,spice and  classy perfume fragrance . Rich and very deeply textured, I was unable to put the glass down for long.  Ohhh yeah!
Your typical Weissbier, has everything you would expect and is therefore just great to drink. I like the cloudiness

A little hazy, tellow/golden beer, with a thick foamy white head. The aroma is malty with wheat and fruity. The taste is sweet bitter with malts and wheat. There are fruits like banana. The aftertaste is bittersweet and dry.

Shared w/ SkyCop32. Picked up at Maruhn Getränke in Darmstadt. Pours a hazy golden orange. Aromas of bread/bananas/ and some fruit. Had a taste of yeasty bread with some spice. Not as clove/banana as most Hefs Ive tried. I would actually seek this one out.

0.5 l bottle.
Hazy orange colour, nice rocky head (which remains like whipped cream), lively (nearly fizzy) carbonation.
Smell of yeast and citrus fruit.
The taste is sourish sweet, sharp, beside a good body and mild mouthfeel.
Flavours of sweetish citrus with yeast.
The finish is tart and light-bitter.
For me a nice and special one and in postive meaning, not an average Hefeweizen.
pours with usual rocky head ,grainy malty nose ,flavour starts sweet then goes to spicy fruity with note of bananas peaches and cinnamon

Bottle 0,5ltr: Hazy yellow tradtional Bavarian Hefeweizen, with hints of banana, its like an good German bread in a glass.
Bottle in Denmark bottle shop. Sharp wheat, banana clove aromas and flavor with a good balanced palate.
Hazy yellow colour with large white head.Aroma is fruity of banana and melon,flavor of yeast and wheat,hoppy and refreshing with fresh mouthfeels yeasty finish.

Barrel Draught at the GBBF Earls Court, London 09/08/2008
Small white head. Banana fruit aroma. Golden coloured and cloudy in appearance with a crisp and slightly spicy full malt finish.

very cloudy yellow, large thick uncler head.
sweet and fresh peachy aroma, no sourness, a little vanilla, no citrus.
flavor is sweet peachy, sweet fruity, dryness, yeast, very round and lild.
low overall beacause my total experience was that the beer is not that drinkable as it was more bitter and almost not sour, and had no citrussy notes.

On tap at the Munich tapCloudy yellow with a thick head.  Vibrant look, its attractive.  Malty, banana-accented aroma with light orchard fruit notes and a slightly footy yeast twang.  Sweet start then turns quite tart and wheaty.  Finishes with some vanilla/cream character amid the wheat.

0.5 l bottle from Beerangel. Hazy yellow brown color. Perfumed and spicy aroma with clove, pepper and banana. Bready and very wheaty flavor with pepper, clove and banana. Oily palate with medium to high carbonation, fairly full bodied. This my old favourite, but this botlle is close to its BB date and probably not at its best.
Top class Weizen. Over all a great beer hard to beat after the other Andechs so I tasted it at home in a take away. Super class.

50cl bottle poured into a weizen glass.  Cloudy golden orange with ample white head.  Aroma is citrus, bananas, bread.  Flavor is the same with some spiciness in the end.  Finish is slightly sour.  Nice brew.

Bottle 50 cl. Off course it pours cloudy, a cloudy yellow with a medium white head and an aroma of vinegar, citrus and some wheat. The flavour is citric, with notes of sour fruits, yeast and some malts. A nice medium sour finish. A good hefeweizen.
500 ml bottle. Aroma has lots of banana, nice addition of pear, too. Deep orange colour, little different than usual weisse. Could have been more thick, feels slightly watery. Great, though!

Sötét,felhős narancssárga szín hatalmas tömör habbal.Illata citrus gyümölcsös,élesztős.Íze is gyümölcsös,banános,kellemesen csípős.Utóíze finom keserédes.Nagyon finom főzet!Bárhol,bármikor szívesen fogyasztanám.Csapolva nagyon kíváncsi vagyok rá.

UPDATED: APR 4, 2009 500ml bottle (BeerAngel.de)
Hazy pale orange, fizzy head. Slightly spritzy sour aroma, just past its BB date. Refreshing carbonation. A touch watery. Yeastiness is a bit earthy. Initial blast of fruity esters quite potent, but fades quickly. Hoppy finish is nice, but not enough to save this. I know Ive had better ones of this. Should rerate.

It doesnt look as most weizens, more orange then yellow.
The aroma is typical, but has more citric notes than normal.
Very solid taste, nothing too much in my opinion.
I really liked it.

Draught in Kloster Andechs. Pours cloudy yellow-orange, with durable white head. Sweet citrus and spice on the nose, with similar on the palate, with notes of malt and yeast too. Very well balanced mouthfeel; archetypal Hefeweizen, a very decent beer.

500 ml bottle. From Germany. BBE 10.03.09. 
Pale golden orange colour with very nice thick smooth white head. Fruity lemon aroma with wheat and toffee. Lemon, banana, some spices and wheat in flavour. Good Hefeweizen.

500 ml bottle straight from Munich courtesy of my mother-in-law in weizen glass.  Pale cloudy orange with lasting white head and lace.  Strong banana bubble gum clove aroma.  Sweet vanilla bubble gum orange fruitiness with spicy finish very light bitterness  Medium-light body nice creamy texture, a little sticky.   My first hefe of the spring, excellent.

UPDATED: FEB 11, 2010 (bottle) pours a hazy golden-yellow colour with a creamy white head. aroma of wheat and clove, some notes of banana and herbal hops. flavour is mostly dry wheat, with a hint of bubble-gum and yeast. medium body with lively carbonation and a light citric finish.
The best weissbeer i have tasted. Really nice and rice. The yeast, maltbody and hops do it really well. Perfect Weissbier
On tap at Wildeman. Hazy yellow with big head. Bananas in the nose. Citrus and banana taste, as well as in the finish. Fruity, easy with bitter finish.
0,5 liter fles. Heerlijke weizen.

Perfect hazy golden coloured body with a dense white head and tons of bubbles rising from the bottom. Aroma of bananas, wheat, yeast, cloves and a bunch of coriander seed. Medium-bodied; Strong flavours of banana, yeast, cloves and curacao with a bit of lemons and citrus coming as well. Aftertaste shows a lot of wheat and yeast - and a bit of the spices. Overall, a very nice unfiltered wheat - definitely one of the best I’ve had. Too bad I can’t get this easily, otherwise I’d be drinking a lot of it! I sampled this 500 mL bottle purchased from Tengelmann Grocery in Munchen, Germany on 15-November-2008, sampled on 03-January-2009.

Great frothy head strong carbonation in a misty straw coloured weiss beer aroma sugar cane wheat malt grassy note clove a fresh aroma flavour malty wheat raw sugar gentle on the moth and going down yet full flavours clove hops arte good backing not tops but a very good wheat beer finish light bitter sweet.
UPDATED: OCT 3, 2009 Excellent German weizen. Another great effort by the monks at Andechs. Nice and cloudy, dark golden color. Excellent balance of taste and fruity aftertaste.

Like a big glass of hazy golden syrup with a big white foaming head.  Bread and lemons pervade.  Awfully smooth with quite a homely feel from the sugared, baguettey aftertaste.  There are a lot of bubbles but they don’t take away from the lovely mouthfeel.  Crisp and clean with a strawberry like sweetness.  Quite a mellow experience, pretty gassy though. That thick head is with you all the way down.
On tap @ in de Wildeman. Cloudy yellow/orange, dense white head. Aroma of wheat and banana. Flavour is thick, sweet, wheat, some citrus and banana. Prickly carbonation-bitter finish.

Bottled. Cloudy orange coloured, lasting head. Fruity nose, more citrus than banana, some spices. Sweet fruity flavour. For a Hefeweizen thin one leans a bit towards a Witbier. Nice, but not outstanding.

UPDATED: FEB 5, 2014 Re-rate 12/10/13: Bottle sample at a tasting at Dancing Camel. Thanks Yoav. Cloudy yellowish orange. Wheaty aroma of lots of banana, a bit overripe, and some clove. Sweetish and slightly tart flavor, with lots of fruity esters, a bit of bubblegum and a light spicy touch in the finish. Rounded mouthfeel. A very nice Weissbier. 7/3/7/4/15=3.6

(6/19/08) Bottle at Aufsturz in Berlin. Cloudy yellow-orange color with a slowly-diminishing big white head. Aroma of wheat, some banana and some spiciness. Sweet fruity flavor with banana notes. Medium-bodied. A very nice Weizen on the sweeter side. 7/3/7/4/15=3.6

Draft at Andechser am Dom. Murky gold with a big white head. Big banana and bubblegummy nose, yeasty and citrusy. Orange flavors really come to the fore in the flavor, balancing perfectly with the other components. Excellent!

No 416
Rated: 30.05.2008
Bottle brown, 500 ml
Appearance: Pours orangy - yellow, a bit metalic shiny - hazy body colour with quite intensive carbonation, there are some cloudy strings of yeasts floating in the body texture. head is huge frothy to creamy with very deep structure of small creamy white grains. Head slowly decreases to medium and lasts than for a long time. Classic appearence of German Hefeweizen. There is also nice lacing.
Aroma: Wheat, yeasts, banana, clove, slightly mineral - salty due to mild carbonation, generally aroma is weak due to a thic head, a bit orangy, lemon peal, some build in barley malt at the background. No alcoholic nose. Well balanced and compound.
Flavour: Front is mild and chewy, medium bodied. There are some good retronasal aromas of wheat, yeast strains, very gentle saltyness on palate with lively carbonation beingsimultaneously gentle on the other  hand. There is exeptional slight hoppy bitterness on palate and clove - flowery nose. Very well balanced with slightly salty average to long finish, slightly alcoholic touch but in a positive way.
Palate: Body is medium, texture is creamy and mild, carbonation is soft to medium on palate, finish feel is light alcoholic and slightly metalic.

Very pale and cloudy yellow with a soft white head that retained pretty well. I get some light bubble gum and banana in the nose, as well as bread and some light lemon. Just a touch of tartness and clove in the beginning of the taste. Bready tastes throughout with some lemon, not very much banana, except there is some in the finish. Lower in carbonation than most, very light body. Makes for a light, refreshing beer that I’d enjoy in the summer, but considering it’s rarity and there being plenty of superior replacements, I’ll drink those instead.

Bottle. High and lasting white creamy head. Hazy light yellow bottle. Good and powerfull fruity aroma of mainly bananas. Flavor as indicated by the aroma: banana with just a wee bit of lemon. Feels a bit thin. Suitable amount of carbonation and a long slightly bitter aftertaste.
Cloudy golden with tiny white head. Banana in the nose with yeasty notes. Sweet wheaty with banana and yeasty notes. Ends sweet.
Hazy yellow with a lasting white head. Aroma is clove with weak banana. Smooth and dry malty flavour, with some yeast notes.
The bottle looks good, the beer in the glass also. Tastes fruity, a little bit like apricot. Sweet finish. Good hefeweizen!

Århus2008. 50 cL bottle. Pours hazy orange with a creamy white head. Aroma is dry wheaty with a solid phenol note. Flavour starts mild sweet and mild spiced. Following this a more dry note appears. Ends with a light dry phenol wheat flavour.
Pours a cloudy slightly dirty looking light gold with a nice sized white head. Aroma is light; clove, wheat, spices, and banana. Flavor is a bit bland, but a nice palate.
(Bottle at Bierstube Alt-Berlin on 2008-02-08) Cloudy, orange colour. Big lasting head. Banana in nose. Hops and banana in taste.
Hazy orange gold with a large white head. Delicious yeasty, wheaty  aroma with cloves. Taste is sweet, yeasty, grainy. Very little dryness. I enjoy this style more and more.

On tap at the Andeches klostergasthof. A densely cloudy golden colour with a good head. A yeasty caramel aroma. Taste has caramel and plenty of bready yeast, banana, wheat and a hint of hops. A good body.
50cl bottle.  Very well done weissbier.  Colour, aroma and flavour good representative what a hefe should be.  Nice blend of citrus and spice.
At the trinkgut in kleve germany, Misty Yellow colour, foamy head, Some banana, and bread, medium base with citrus, very well weissbier.

UPDATED: FEB 6, 2015 Rerate, sampled from a bottle. Pours a hazy lemon with a large frothy off-white head. Good head retention. Aroma of yeast, doughy malt, citrus, clove, floral notes. The taste is yeast, bread, spice, clove. Medium bodied, lingering spice. Much better than my earlier example. 7/3/7/4/15/3.6Bottle. Thanks bierkoning. Pours a very hazy orange with a medium frothy head. Doesnt last and lacing isnt great. Strong banana aroma with a sourness that came across as a bit olivey. (Is that a word?). Very, very thin. Taste of bread, marshmallow and banana. Very weak beer. 4/3/6/2/8/2.3
Draught @ MicroBar, Clapham Nov07. Golden colour small head. Aroma is banana / malts / alcohol. Taste is yeasty / fruity. Mouthfeel is smooth with nice long finish.

Bottled 50cl. It pours a hazy orange beer with a beautiful, nicely lasting head. The nose is yeasty, woody with quite a lot of banana. A slight hint of rosemary. Faintly grainy with buttery undertones. A strange chicken food-like touch to the aroma too. Some sourness showing up. The taste is slightly sour, nicely woody, grainy with lots of bananas and hints of cloves. Medium bodied with a nice spicy, smooth mouthfeel. Some wood and nuts accompanied by apples showing up just before the finish which is yeasty, sour with hints of apples.

Hazy yellow/straw coloured body with a huge white head. Aroma was of banana followed by some cloves. I was looking for a refreshing beer on a bloody hot Xmas day and this beer did the job. Some yeast characters come through in the taste, after the banana,  straightforward and what you want from a hefeweizen.

bottled. Pours a cloudy deep golden colour with a huge long lasting nice creamy white head leaving a good lacing. Aroma of banana, wheat and yeast. Great mouthfeel. The flavour is sweetish and fresh, fruity with banana, wheat, yeast, some citrus and ho[ps. Dry fruity, wheaty long lasting finish. Ya! Great brew indeed!

Bottled(500ml). -Hazy pale yellow coloured, huge white head, fizzy, fresh fruity (lemony) nose. Mild wheaty and fair fruity (banana, lemon, touch of apple). Notes of glue in the finish. Typical german weissbier.

Thanks to, I believe madsberg, for the long ago trade and his incredible patience.  Held up very well despite the storage.  A fresh, tart/fruit aroma and a nice fluffy head (though it didnt last too long).  Mouthfeel is balanced, bouncy wheat with sticky sweet, and flavors range from the typical yeast, bananas and clove to a touch of citrus and clean acidic finish.  Very nicely done.

Hazy, golden weissbier with a moderate head and an aroma with notes of yeast and wheat. The flavour is refreshing with sweetness, yeast, wheat, fruit (banana) and citrus notes - that makes the finish a bit wit-like, nice...
Alla spina; color oro torbida con schiuma abbondante. Aroma fortemente citrico con poca banana; sapore leggermente piccante grazie al contenuto alcolico leggermente alto per lo stile. Buona.

Cask at Microbar, Clapham. Intense banana nose dominates the faint yeast aroma.  Colour is a cloudy yellow/cream. Head is solid and firm. Soft mouth feel. Some alcohol through the nose while drinking. Sweet and dry. A nice beer.

Light,lemony,bananay aroma, big old rocky head, very smooth lemon maraguine and banana taste,with that incredible soft bubble texture that only this brewery seems to be able to do,seriously there is something holy about that water they are using,and we were told that people make pilgrimages to the monastary to use the water,as it has been known to cure blindness. Somewhat light ,as are all the beers these good monks make(except for their dopple),but still very fine

On tap at Andechs on our honeymoon.  Pours a cloudy yellow with a tall white head.  Lemon citrus yeast banana and clove aroma.  Quite abundant and appetizing.  Lemon flavors yeasty creamy sweet but slightly drying in the finish.  Tasty beer.

UPDATED: FEB 7, 2011 Always one of my faves. Heavy on the clove and banana esters. High carbonation with slight prickle is nice, keeps it light on the tongue. the malt character is nice, well-integrated into the yeasty esters. Finishes with nice acidity and is quaffable, not too sticky. The historical and cultural significance of the brewery is testimony to the enduring quality of this simply structured yet supremely quaffable array of beers. Their biggest strength lies more in the beers overall character, appearance, and effect on the soul.

pours a foamy (a bit shampoo-type) head ... the color is a bit muddy ... the smell is a bit of overripe pears ... taste is fruity (peach, mango) with a shot of grenadine syrup ... all in all the brew is suited for amateurs of rather sweet drinks ....

This is one of the best wheat beers in the world, Nice aroma, great taste. The aroma and taste hás note of vanilla, banana. The beer is of course unclear.

Bottle. Cloudy, orangey golden with a good white head. Good banana and spice aroma, with clove. Clove and banana flavours. Dryish finish. Well-carbonated. I find many weizen very similar, but this one stands out for its balance between fruit and spices. Very good.

Draught at Delirium Café, Göteborg, Sweden. Deep hazy golden, large white head. Fruity aroma with bananas and strawberries, along with yeast and spicy notes. Medium bodied with good carbonation, nicely balanced with a refreshing acidity.

Courtesy boboski.  Poured a cloudy radiant yellow-orange color with a stark white head.  Dank clove and white pepper aroma that is pretty stimulating.  Medium-bodied, feathery palate.  Slightly sweet start, dark fruit, cloves, and some spice in the finish.  Very good.

Highly carbonated, medium-sized white head, cloudy light golden and yellow body. Very pretty, bearing a slight resemblance to white grapefruit juice topped with velvety foam. The nose is quenching before the liquid even nears my lips. Wheat leads, then banana and grated clove. Light nuances of orange and grassy hops bounce around in between waves of wheat and baked banana peels. The flavor is ruled by grass, banana and hefty wheat. Bitterness is light,, acidity is light to mild, sweetness is medium to medium-high and never overwhelming. Mild balance, leaning towards sweet toast and complimented by a growing hop presence with each sip. Finishes grassy, lightly to moderately bitter and lively. The mouthfeel is lively as well, very highly carbonated but still retains a silky feeling. A great hefe, though a touch too sweet after repeated sips.

Pours a cloudy light straw gold.  Kind of like a grapefruit juice-cuvee de castleton look alike.  Alot of citrus fruit in the nose, the wheat seems to be secondary.  Very fresh smelling, makes it really inviting.  A little bit of some earthiness and spice aromas stand out too.  The taste has a good amount of nutmeg and clove spice.  They jump out immediately.  The fruit and wheat seem to be in the background as well.  I really think its a cool flavor for a weizen.  Fresh tasting as well, with a minty freshness left on the palate in the aftertaste.  Awesome wheat beer.

One of the best wheatbeer I have ever tasted, lots of vanilla in the aftertaste, good combination with the malt and yeast. Long aftertaste, dominated by the mild hops and a touch of well-placed sourness
Hazy golden colour, firm white head. Aromas: grassy, a touch of banana. Smooth beer, moderately bitter. A good Hefeweizen.

Vom fass at the Market, Olympiapark München 18 Jun 07. Yellowish golden coloured. A small white head. Unclear. Pleasant fruity aroma. Very carbonated. Citrus and banana in the flavor. Sweet bitter finish.

Hazy golden with a fantastic white head. Banana, wheat & citrus flavor. The aroma especially is wonderfull and appearance... wauw. The texture is a bit watery. Classic taste (which is not up to par with the aroma and appearance) of banana/wheat. Light citric notes. Very enjoyable afterall.

500ml bottle shared with Finn at a marked in the Olympiapark, München. Hazy orange body with head retention on a low level. Nice aroma of cloves and banana. More ripe banana in the taste offset by a rounded touch of spicy tartness preventing the brew from getting too sweet. Medium bodied. Should be one of the better German Weissbier (18.06.2007).

Bottled (thanks DerDoppelbock).Hazy golden colour with big slightly off-white foamy/bubbly head.  Aroma is Big time bananas, wheat and some quite sourish notes. Flavour is wheat, a lot of sourish fruits, some yeast and mild touch of banana.
Bottle at home... Clowdy orange yellow ... typical bubnble gum wheat nose ... ligth but very fruity ... slightly sharp sour fruit ... light banana wheat ... could do with more depth.
Nose is banana & clove, slight butter presence in the malt, perhaps a hint of bubblegum.  Flavor is banana, sweet malt w. slightly more prominent gum.  A bit of lemon in the wheaty finish.

Bottle. Pours a beautiful yellow - much like the label on the bottle - just with far more pang to it. It is very murky and has lots of bubbles in the liquid. Head is milky white and looks creamy from the top. Aroma is stunning for the type - exotic fruits, wheat, banana and very sweet. Surprisingly full mouthfeel with small bubbles dancing on my tongue. Flavour is mild, well-rounded and super. There is an initial vanilla edge to the banana/wheat combo, then a lingering floral bitterness breaks through. Long aftertaste, dominated by the mild hops and a touch of well-placed sourness. The weisse to beat Maisels.

UPDATED: SEP 22, 2013 1)Bottled. Milky, lemon curd haziness with a creamy but short-lived head of froth. Thick, creamy palate. Tropical fruit bubblegum sweetness in the nose. Fruity but fairly abrupt. Finishes with a clean, savoury wheatiness. A bit wishy-washy for the ABV and not as rounded as fruitier specimens. But still a silky treat. 746414=3.5
2) Couple of bottles from Arden Wines, 22/09/13, one toppled all over the worktop impersonating Partridge. Big banana, bubblegum and mauby aroma. Viscid, effervescent and awash with spicy esters suggesting Bazooka chews, coriander and overripe bananas on toast sprinkled with clove and cinnamon. Blew Baumburger and Hacker Pschorr out of the water. 848416=4.

Bottled. Very cloudy yellow colour with a rich and sticky white foam. Very fruity aroma of wheat, cloves, banana and wheat with mild spicy undertones. Medium-bodied with a very fruity and wheaty flavour of over-riped banans, Seville oanges and cloves. Creamy mouthfeel. Long, fresh finish of cloves, Seville oranges, banana and almonds.

On tap at Reading BF 2007, bottled bright and drunk on train on way home.  Cloudy orange/gold with thin white head.  Banana, some cereal cardboard aroma.  Very light and lemony in mouth.  More lemon/banana than some.  Finish has a lemon curdy zest that is pleasing.  Full yet soft.  Really rather nice.  A lighter weisse.

Bottle. @ Copenhagen Øl Festival. Average white fizzy head that mostly lasted. Good lacing. Hazy orange color. Lovely aroma of banana, citrus, yeast, coriander, clove, caramel, fruit and wheat. Medium bodied with an average carbonation. Balanced sweet malt flavor with some acidic. Refreshing sweet finish with hint of acidic at the very end.
Bottled. Poured a cloudy pale orange with a white, rocky head. Aroma of yeast, cloves and a touch of citrus. Flavours of ripe banana, cinnamon and bread. A good wheat beer.

Draught at Monks Café, Stockholm.  Cloudy amber minimal head. Estery banana aroma with cloves and red berreis. Restrained malt sweetness, soft spritzy mouthfeel. Medium bodied and lightly fruity. Keeps restrained, well balanced and in perfect control. Has all you can ask of a hefeweizen.

UPDATED: NOV 18, 2007 Bottled. An unclear dark golden beer with a huge, rocky and persistent white head. The aroma is wheaty, yeasty and malty with notes of banana, lemon and cloves. Some light bread too. The flavour has a medium sweetness and a good level of a lovely refreshing acidity. A very light herbal hop bitterness in the finish. Banana and lemon are well present together with some spiciness. Medium to full body, strong carbonation, long aftertaste. perfectly balanced and not too filling, how I like in a hefeweizen. As usual a very interesting product from Andechser, that I really appreciate.

Draught  Good white head over fully hazy yellow-orange beer. Spicey-bittery nose (nutmeg, ginger) and banana-orange mix. Whiffs of CO². Sweetish-sourish with good balance fruit-wheat-grain. Sourish finish (fruity and lightly lactic) and banana. Not really pappery, but quite full-bodied. Better than average Weisse. Nose is intriguing.

[bottle]
Sour, candylike clove aroma accentuated by noble hops.  One of the whitest Ive seen: opaque pineapple juice with a touch of guava added.  Foamy cover quickly recedes to wisps. Flavour is out of balance in the hops, which also give off a late bitterness that detracts from this beer.  Otherwise, pleasant phenolics that are masked by a minearal watery feel and taste.  Medium body, elevated carbonation, slightly metallic.
(Draught) Pours hazy yellow. Light spicy and light banana aroma with salt, cloves and yeast. Light citrusy, spicy flavour with wheat and salt. Medium body.

On tap at Delirium Café in Göteborg:
Yellow hazy colour, with a flat head.
Aroma of malt,citric, sweet banana. Flavor:is almost the same a bit of Vine, sparkling mouth feeling. Light to medium body, medium finish.. Nice!

On tap at Delirium Café, Göteborg. Hazy, pale yellow with a small white foam. Banana, citrus and hoppy notes.
Medium body with a long aftertaste.
Bottle: Poured a golden amber with a pillowy white head. Smelled sour wheaty/yeasty citrus aroma. The taste was bitter with a thick bread loaf feel and finish.

Bottle. Hazy golden yellow color with a large good lacing white head. Aroma is banana, gum, moderate hoppy, citrus, moderate yeasty. Flavor is moderate sweet and light bitter with a average to long duration. Nice and refreshing. Body is light to medium, texture is watery, carbonation is soft.
I dont really like weisses, but this is one of the better ones. I will have to re-evaluate this one, but at the moment I can say its quite drinkable without excessive sweetness.

(Bottle, Priory Arms, Stockwell, London, 24 Nov) Golden yellow colour, hazy, with huge white head. Fruity nose with banana, slightly sweetish wheat notes, clove and a hint of smoke. Fruity taste, slightly sweet, with a distinct banana note and hints of clove. Very full banana/wheat character. Very nice.

Vom fass @ Andescher am Dom, München, Germany.  The peak of Summer, the sun now directly upon us and the little shade outside barely enough to shelter us from the heat, but who cares really.. We found the Andescher brewery tap!!! Second of many fine beers. Into a weissbier glass it presented well. Massive, layered, rocky white crown atop an opaque, pastel gold body tinged by a chestnut hue. Carbonation was typically high, erupting from eddying streams inside. Subtle ripe banana and fresh squeezed lemons on the nose, quite fresh. More zingy lemons and banana inside to be joined by some original grapefruit, apple and pear flavours to make for a very juicy palate indeed. Its light in body and the carbonation makes sure it bounces across the tongue but is not harsh or upsetting. Finish is crisp, a light band-aid note, definite cloves in there before it fades out to leave just a little banana and bubblegum. A sour edge becomes pronounced as it heats up, sweetness is well-controlled and it honestly tastes better more cool than chilled. A nicely balanced, intricately created hefe. This monastic brewery cannot do anything wrong. This was lovely stuff.

It was just before noon at Kloster Andechs when we sat down to enjoy this one.  The Sunday service could still be heard through the PA system.  No, it really doesnt get much better than this.  And this wasnt even the best beer we sampled, but it was the first.  More than adequate hefe with all the clovey banana goodness you could want.
Hazy yellow/orange, white head. Malty, yeasty wheat aroma. Bready and a bit hoppy flavor, some banana. Malty finish.

Bottle. Pours a hazy yellow/orange colour with a longlasting white head. Malty yeasty aroma with lots of bananas and clove hints. Sweet malty yeasty banana and clove flavor. Malty yeasty aftertaste with hints of bananas. A nice one.

Big thanks to SoG!  Lightly cloudy straw color with a moderate white head. Aromas of heavy yeast with sweet light fruit including bananas and other light fruit. Flavors follow scents, with bananas and mild raisins. Finish and linger teem with light wheat and mild clove. A quite capable weissbier.

Nice typical pour, perfectly crowned head, sat just beautifully in the weizen glass. Pale yellow to yellow pour and cloudy. The aroma was citrus, wheat, and spices. As it warmed, the flavor added to a basic citrus and lightly clovey elements a stronger spicing, including not only cloves but also peppers. Finish was a little dry and with a lightly acidic mouthfeel. The banana-like esters were minor players in this one and it was rather refreshing (slightly sour) for a summer evening at the grill.

Pre-GTMW tasting @ 1FastSTis place. Hazy pale with white head. The aroma is banana, slight bubblegum and apricot. The flavor is light, slightly floral, light pepper and lemon. The mouth is soft and light.

Slightly hazed gold. Fizzy white head.
Sweet wheaty elixir aroma. 
Sweet wheat infused well water. Very good and well put together. The well water hints at minerals, which are sweetly laced.

Hazy, bright and yellow-orange in color with an icy sheaf of white gracing the top and spawning lovely clinging white lace.  Unfathomable bananas and cloves grace the nose with a sugary sweet enclave along with a subtly tart note and substantive graham saturated banana meringue pie.  Effervescence breezes in and pils malt base imparts a husky lead-in.  Warming and tingly, with strong green cloves supping with ripe green bananas.  Fades minorly as each sip digests with a harsh and husky bite, though the honey graham sweetness and minor lime rind crustiness keep it well balanced.  Cloves and sharp margarine laden the palate at the finish.

Thanks Joel.  The beer pours to a hazy straw colored body with a thin white head.  The aroma is yeasty, lemon, pepper, and wheat.  The flavor is wheat, yeast, bananas, and light pepper.  The palate is tart, medium-light bodied.

Bottle provided by Joel: Hazy yellow hue with a mall frothy head. The aroma has notes of banana, clove, wheat and dusty grains. This smells like a quality hefeweizen. The taste had a balanced spice and sweet fruit character with a constant wheaty background. The mouth feel is oily and very smooth, refreshing. Overall it is a darn good hefe that I would easily drink again.

Pre-Great Taste sampling at 1FastStis house

This was opened early on in the night.  I believe StewartOfGondor brought it
   though I lost track of who brought what by the end of the night.  It was a
   nice way to kick off the night; thoroughly enjoyable and it would be quite
   simple to down litres of it at the monastery.  The Germans really know how to
   make good beer.
Aroma / Appearance - The nose is solid but not complex.  I was able to
   pick up hints of banana, honeycomb, white bread and a trace of limes.  The
   body was mostly clear with a golden tint and carbonation percalating to the
   top at a nice pace.
Flavor / Palate - The first sip was almost like drinking liquified
   Wonderbread.  Soon though it unfolds into a mashup of banana, vanilla ice
   cream and boston cream pie.  The finish is slightly dry with a light hoppy
   aftertaste.  This would be a great session beer for a warm summer day if you
   could actually get it locally.
Thanks to StewardofGhondor. Pours a hazy yellow color, big white fluffy head. Flavor is sharp, strong and easy to drink.  Almost refreshing. Great stuff.
I had a few liters of this at the monastery.  What a great day and experience.  A great ferman hefe full of flavor.  One of the best.
bottle. murky yellow color. medium creamy head. fruity hop. very carpy. sweet and light. spicy pallete.
Bottle. Hazy golden in colour with a small white head. Sweet and fruity. Banana notes. Tastes a bit artificial.

Beautiful; Very pleasant balanced nose; Great balance and elegance in body; Into long, deep and complex finish. The best balanced weissbier i ever had. I is actually a quite incredible beer with depth, balance and elegance as well as being incredibly well made.

UPDATED: AUG 8, 2007 Draft glass
Consumed at In de Wildeman, Amsterdam, May 2006
Very cloudy orange and brown colored body with a big tan head.  Nose of oranges, wheat, some lemon scents, overall smelling like a pleasent, melloe yeasty citrus.  Palate is wet, peppery, alive.  Rounded tart wheat and lemon flavors. Very good example of a proper German hefeweizen.

Bottle. Creamy white excellent fully lasting head. Yellow cloudy colour. Powerfull hoppy aroma, not as yeasty as other hefe. Very powerfull fruity taste. I detect aplle/lime notes. A little watery palate but still good. Lively carbonated.

UPDATED: MAY 13, 2006 Bottled.  Pillowy white head on a opaque cloudy orange/golden pour.  Aroma of wheat, yeast, bananas, citrus, cloves - perfect weizenfunk.  Even has some subtle bread/dough maltiness.  Fruity, tangy taste, full-flavored but not full-bodied.  Smooth, but citrus dominates the other flavors - doesnt get full marks.  Spicy from the middle on, peaks in the finish.  Clean, balanced, refreshing - top-notch Hefe.

A great looking beer, hazy gold with an immense white head which is maintained by a torrent of bubbles rising to the top. The nose is typically spicy and slightly sour. The palate is a bit lighter than I expected, however its still good stuff, there is a rather subdued spice, and that typical wheat beer sharpness. Overall, a crackin beer, could have done with a bit more body to make it classic. From Little Germany,Grangemouth.

(bottle) Cloudy hazy orangey colour with a big fluffy foamy white head. Yeasty and dusty sweet wheat-malty aroma, slightly banana-fruity and clovy. Slightly sweet flavour, medium to light body, smooth carbonation (for a Weizen). Decent standard Weizen taste with a slightly tart finish. Ok but not absolutely convincing for a Andechser.
Good, and very nice, but the flavour is not as strong as I wanted, probably edging a Wit Bier. But the head is nice.

ahhh yes, the Germans know how to make a hefe-weiss.  this is about as good as it gets!  a lumenscent yellow with a fluffy white head.  wonderful aromas and light flavors of banana, clove and lemon grass.  medium-bodied and so very thirst quenching.  Big thanks to Saarlander for this German Gem.

500ml bottle: poured a brilliant deep yellow with a medium sized fluffy white head. Moderate aroma of yeast with light banana. Very clean tasting with a crisp finish. This will probably be my every day hefeweizen. I really enjoyed it.
Golden colour with a nice mostly lasting creamy white head. Aroma and taste of yeast, fruits and citrus. Nice palate.

Bottle: Quite light golden with a tinge of orange, mid-sized creamy white head, quite stable; robust fruity nose (mainly citrus, also bananas, some berries, nearly no cloves(!)) sweetish-fruity flavour, quite light bodied, some acidity detectable; quite dry, a bit tart and fruity finish. A very pleasant Weizen - no horrible dental cloves.................

Bottle from Beers of Europe. Pours a standard sort of cloudy creamy yellowwith a typically large head. Aroma is fruity/estery with fruity and spice. Very smooth to taste with spice, banana and other things like that. This is in many ways a typical Hefeweizen but it overshadows others. Very nice.

UPDATED: JAN 30, 2006 Enjoyed a one liter maas  of this beer at the monastery/ brewery. Outstanding Southern Bavarian hefeweizen, with fantastic aromas and flavors. This beer pours to a beautiful, opaque, bright golden color, with a tall, thick, creamy white head, and a vibrant carbonation. Lots of big aromas of clove, banana, and pear marry with good malted wheat aroma. The palate is firm with lots of good tart malted wheat character with a nice estery "bubble gum" note, This beer finishes very delicious and refreshing with more wheat flavor, and hints of clove that lingers. Without question one of the most impressive hefeweizens being brewed today from a very special place for beer lovers. Climb "Beer Mountain", and enjoy what Andechs has to offer.
Quite tasty but perhaps I had a bad bottle - it was super-foamy and made it difficult to drink (nuf said sorry)

Bottle from Beers of Europe. Cloudy sparkling golden yellow with massive head. Orange, yeast and vanilla dominate the aroma with the banana and clove more in the background. Good spritzy mouthfeel with some actual hop evident in the finish. Excellent hefeweizen.

On tap at the Monastery at Andechs in Germany.  The Weissbier I compare all others by.  A great beer along with the saurkraut and schweinshaxe I consumed.  Served by the monks who brewed it.  Id like to know how it translates to bottle and whether its available in USA.
Bottled. Yellow-orange hazy beer with white head. Aroma is citrus, mostly grapefruit, and spices. Fruity flavor with pleasant levels of co2. Refreshing. (051104)

50 cl bottle. Yeast in bottom. Cloudy golden colour with a nice white head. Great aroma of yeast and wheat, very much like bread also some notes of banana. Nice flavour also of wheat and pleasant yeast taste.

50 cl Bottel
Coler - Yellow/Light Amber
Head - Withe
Aroma - Wheat, Hops
Flavor - Wheat, Hops
Nice weissbier

a sim rate:
A very delicious weiss! My first instinct was that it smells and tastes like cake. And I love a bit of cake! White sponge cake. Yup. Otherwise, banana in the aroma and flavour. Very wheaty. Smooth and slightly tangy. Yum!

Good weizzen. yellow/golden beer with a big white head. aromas of vanilla, citrus, banana and yeast. taste: wheat, vanilla, sourrish, lemony and spicy. strong banana finish with an alc. hint. very refreshing and tasty. maybe a bit thin at the end...

Bit aggressive carbonation, crisp and refreshing. Banana in yeast and pronounced lemony sharpness turned me off somewhat . Faint hint of metallic. Considered one of the best labels not available in North America.With appreciation to Madsberg in Denmark in a trade.
Pours golden with a thick pillowy head.Aroma is fruity as is the tatse.Hints of citrus and slight banana.This was clean and refreshing
Draft, Wildeman. Thick cloudy gold-brown color, medium white head. Strong aroma of banana, wheat and some yeast. Sweet banana taste, wheat. Typical example of a german hefeweizen, but good brewn.
UPDATED: SEP 28, 2005 Hazy golden colour and a small, but lasting head. Bubblegum, banana and lemon notes in the aroma. Generously carbonated. Sweet crispy malt notes, grainy, yeasty flavour.
(Bottle 50 cl) Very pretty yellowish golden, cloudy wit a typical tall and frothy head. Very full-bodied and fruity with a long, smooth aftertaste. A top class Hefe. 030900
Bottle (GBBF): Nice clove and bubblegum nose. Tangy medium mouthfeel. Cloudy gold with a lasting white head. Sweet honey malt notes, grainy, yeasty flavour. Nice weisse.
Wow, what a great weissbier, very smooth, fruity, and fresh, thank you to my wife for bringing it back from Germany, quite fruity tasting. Very refreshing. One of the better weissbiers Ive tasted.

Bottle -  GBBF 2005.  A very hazy yellow coloured beer with a nice moussey white head.  The aroma was very inviting with lots of banana and bubblegum.  The taste is wheaty and lemony with yeast notes and some bubblegum.  A good thick bodied hefe.

Draught at Berliner Bierfestival.
Hazy yellow coloured with a huge white head.
Sweet fruirt aroma dominated by bananas.
Sweet fruity flavour with notes of bananas, spices and yeast.
Bottle.  Nice pour typical color and head for a helles.  What sets this apart is the very clean taste.  Refreshing but not overly hoppy.

Couleur dorée, apparence presque opaque, faible formation de mousse blanche.  Flaveurs plutôt levurés, forte en épicés auquel le gingembre sest taillé une place de choix aux côtés des citrons et des bananes bonbon.  Flaveurs ramenant les bananes et les levures sous une touche dherbe.  Corps dépaisseur semi mince à moyenne, carbonatation piquante en bouche.  Voyager peut parfois être fatiguant mais permet de voir de beau panoramas.  Pas en excellente forme.

Hazy golden body, average white foam with no lacing. Enormously yeasty aroma. It first makes me think of bark, there is big banana in there. Gentle phenols, everything at the right place at the right moment. Beautifully balanced, if I appreciated hefes a lot more, I might shoot for high 4s. Light cloves, sweet, well displayed. Tarter than I expected in mouth though, it makes it all the more refreshing, but Im not sure I enjoy it as much as the aroma, it is very fruity, yet not very sweet, mostly floral with green herbs hints. Thin-medium bodied, spritzy carbonation, but not lasting. Great aroma..

UPDATED: SEP 15, 2005 Original Rating (8-3-7-3-15=3.6): Doughy yeast, bananas ,citrus, cream and wheat in the fresh and appealing aroma.  Opaque yellow-gold with a low but lasting cover of white head.  Sweet banana flavour with herbal and vanilla character leading to a mild but notable finishing bitterness.  Creamy mouthfeel with fair carbonation that is perhaps somewhat low for style.  Bottle (BB 9/05) enjoyed with beerbuzzmontreal, MartinT, Olivier_MTL, Rastacouere and Yowie.Rerate (8-3-8-4-15=3.8): Thick, creamy banana aroma with caramel and clove undertones.  Opaque yellow-tan with low but lasting white, fine-bubbled head.  Banana esters and clove phenols fill the mouth in the lead up to a fair finishing bitterness and a lasting fruity sweetness in the aftertaste.  Medium-light body with strong crisp carbonation and creamy texture.  Bottle sampled at GBBF 2005.  I have this listed as Andechs Kloster Weiss.

The Lure:Bold banana sweetness and bountiful lemony herbs rejoice. Minty wheat spikes curiosity, this is rich and really interesting.
The Festivities:A full mouthfeel promotes honeyed bananas and those herbaceous connotations again. Simple, different and quenching, a tad less sweet than the aroma suggested. 

Transcendence:A tropical kitchen hides so many indigenous wonders.

Excellent aroma of banana, lemon, cloves and bubble gum. Cloudy yellow color with a ring of white lace. Excellent, complex flavor of banana, lemon, herbs, clove and bubble gum. The body is medium, the texture creamy and the carbonation moderate. Excellent weizen.
A little different from other german wheat guyz, but still the same clove, banana flavour. Also a little more hoppy than other wheat beers iv had, very light body too.
Hmm. Cloudy yellowish beer. Typical Banana-aroma. Picked up some banana in the taste, together with some ash, but I found it rather weak. Lively carbonation, even on draught. Nothing special..

UPDATED: SEP 24, 2005 Cloudy appearance.. slightly more orange than amber. Nice head and wheaty aroma. Banana flavor with some spices.. perhaps clove and vanilla.. hint of cinnamon. Not too heavy like other weizens Ive had.
Cloudy orange. A classic Greman weisse. Nothing special though. Pretty average.

Bottle, at No. 5.
Light yellow, not filtered, nice head. Aroma of yeast. Light fruity flavor.

UPDATED: APR 21, 2010 Above average german wheat.  Nice cloudy yellow body with a modest white head.  Aroma is very yeasty, in addition to banana and clove and a hint of vanilla.  Flavor is wheat and phenols like clove, but there is still banana there too.  Good smooth body- not too heavy but not too thin either.  Moderately smooth finish with  just a little bite to it.

Pours a beautiful cloudy golden colour with a good head. Excellent Weiss aroma, but then it goes a bit downhill from there. The taste could be more exhilarating, and the mouthfeel is a bit watery. A beer that promises more than it can deliver, and decidedly sub-par for the otherwise great Andechser beers.

Bottle.  Strong banana/peach/clove/yeast aroma.  Yellow-tan cloudy color - tons of bubbles and moderate head. Sweet banana/apple malt flavor - high carbonation and no bitterness.  Good body.  A very good Weizen.

UPDATED: SEP 27, 2009 Dark yellow color with murky appearance. Rich banana and yeast aroma, spices come up nicely. Thin to medium bodied, carbonated palate. Flavor is wheaty with banana and yeast, hops come up in aftertaste. Crispy and fruity weizen.

Cloudy gold colour. Very pronounced vanilla aroma, with cloves and spices and something almost smoky in the background. Yeasty, bittersweet flavour. A very firm wheat beer. Not a lot of banana. Very much to my taste. 500ml bottle from beersofeurope.co.uk
Hazy golden color, light banana citrus aroma and fresh taste, medium body, sparkeling finish.
Bottle. Cloudy yellow-orange colour with nice head. Banana, quite spicy (cloves, cinammon), light acidity. Refreshing.

On tap at the brewery. This may be the best wheatbeer that I have EVER tasted. Being there probably has a lot to do with the raving. This place is beyond description with its sweet lovely, pastoral setting. The beer is not beyond description. Enormous head even after they threw it at me and I lost a portion. Estery and frothy. Cloudy and tart, but malt balance was nearly flawless. All beer lovers must make the pilgrimage to Andechs. You will not be disappointed.

At the brewery, July 2003.  1 liter stein:  absolutely beautiful brew.  Cloudy, fizzy, orange - lots of foam.  Big overripe banana aroma.  Crisp, tart, fresh and refreshing flavor with classic clove.  A delight

Cloudy light orange with a bubbly head of white foam.  Aromas are wheat, banana and spritzy citrus.  Flavours are citrus fruit sourness with wheat, spices and banana.  Has a vapour-dry finish.  A good weisse.

Golden cloudy body with a puffy white head. Aroma is quite light, with a big yeast component. Banana and almonds flavors with a small sourness that is highlighted by the mild carbonation. Extremely smooth on mouth and thirst quenching. Overall a very good weizen that needs a little bit more of nose.

(Bottled) Opaque, yellow-orange color with a medium head. Slightly watery banana-bubblegum aroma. Light, sweetish and cornyish flavor with banana. Light to medium-bodied palate with balanced carbonation. An OK, light and easily drinkable weizen, but nothing special.

tap @ andechser house.  beautiful deep orange cream color with frothy white head.  flavor hinted at orange peels and a bit of sourness.  the flavor didnt end too well with me ( a bit watery ) but it was a delicious mama jamma nonetheless especially since i was surrounded by drunken germans..ARG!

50 cl bottle. Served in Brøckhouse glass.

Hazy apple-sauce color. Large head. Impressively fruity, delicate, and inviting aroma - very fresh and well-rounded. The taste is well-balanced and full. Lively, pleasant mouthfeel. Good drinkability.

Bottle. Cloudy, orange gold coloured, with minimal tight head and some lacing. Aroma is spicy and banana fruity. Some cloves in the taste along with bubblegum, light malts and hops. Highly carbonated, smooth and full bodied. Bitter sour finish and aftertaste. Good one.
Bottle. Fresh and citrusy.

(on bottle)I´ve heard about these german munks for a while, but I´m gonna skip the other beers from this kloster. Way to sweet ´n´yeasty for my tounge. Lots of the usual bananaflavours, o much that any other impression disapears. And it´s even flat in the aftertaste.

On tap at Andechser am Dom in Munich. Hazy copper color, huge head and gorgeous lace. Rich yeast, moderatly malty lightly spicy aroa. Taste is smooth and light, spicy predominatly clove tones, lightly malty, lightly citrusy with hints of bannana. Best weissbeer I have ever had.
UPDATED: FEB 12, 2007 This is always a solid hefeweizen, be it on bottle or tap. Good esters, bit of phenols in aroma. Full body. Perfect balance of fruitiness and phenols.

Bottled at DBF 2004.
Golden with a cereal aroma.
Rather lively with clove-aroma.
Stroong banana aroma and flavor, that is even surpassing the strong yeastiness. Golden color, but ver cloudy. Sweetish and loveable but lacks tartness and complexity.
Cloudy golden colour. Yeasty, citric aroma. Crisp, citric taste. Typical banana, yeast notes. Really nice, refreshing weizen.
Hazy golden colour with nice foamy head. Aroma is fruity and spicy. Flavor is average, but with some spices. Palate is typical weissbier.
Cloudy blond color. Quite strong aroma, typical, spicy but also fruity. Quite dry in the front, strong spicy character in the middle, a bit fruity (banana, apple) at the end. Correctly bitter.
Draft at Andechs - The appearance of this Weissbier is amazing. More orange than yellow with very crisp flavors that are much more complex than many of the other Hefe's I've had.

UPDATED: APR 6, 2004 Bottle from the Swan and Rushes, Leicester. This is really an archetypal quality German Hefeweizen. Deliciously smooth, with a calm balanced taste of orange, lemon and yeast. Hazy lemon colour, which is nice. A pleasing thick head too. This is a great experience and is all about refreshment and flavour.
Quite smoked aroma and flavor. Wheat and yeast are dominating features by this brew. Quite alcoholic too.
UPDATED: SEP 4, 2004 Nice hazy golden color. The aroma is nice with hints of banana and citrus. The taste is fruity with a nice citrusy flavor.

Bottle. GBBF2003. Hazy gold, moderate white head and good condition. Good phenol and banana wheat notes in the aroma, not very sweet in the mouth becoming quite dry and powdery in the finish with a lingering banana note.

Amazing cloudy and honey-like yellow/orange colour with a huge white head. Good fruity aroma (banana). Great tasty and refreshing flavour with a pleasant combination of fruits and spices (cloves). Even has a slightly bitter finish. All in all a wonderful German weissbier - and probably the most beautiful one I have had yet!
Very, very nice hefeweissen                                                                    .
a very enjoyable hefeweizen. Citrus and fruity aroma and a surprisingly fresh tasting..
An unclear orange beer with a beutiful head. The aroma is a light wheat aroma with notes of yeast. The flavor is of oranges, wheat, and yeast. A nice wheat beer.

Cloudy golden color with a banana, clove, and citrus aroma - everything you could ask for in a German wheat.  Great bready yeast flavor and finish.  Fizzy, yet smooth palate.  Well-balanced and a good weissbier.

Mit hefe.  Beautiful cloudy yellow color after we roused the sediment.  Mouthfeel is just right we subtantial body generated from wheat malt.  They must use a great strain of yeast too because the banana/clove profile of this beer was maybe the best I've ever had in a bottle, in the US.  THose Germans know their stuff.  Very authentic weissbier.

(Bottle). Lovely cloves aroma, typical hefe. Cloudy golden colour, pours with a large head. Fairly dry flavour, typical wheat / cloves, slightly peppery. A bit more hops would do, still this is a well made hefe, as you would expect when dedicated monks guarantee the quality. Recommended! (Thanks, joss!)

golden hazy color,
big fluffy head.
 nose of bread, clove banana anda bit of citrus.
taste was equally complex yet a refrshing  and filling weizen.
Hazey pale beer, probably dark orange.  Bitter and citric aroma with a very nice bubble gum flavour mixed with deep bitterness.  A great beer but just slightly too bitter in its content.

UPDATED: NOV 25, 2011 Draught at Kloster Andechs. Head is fully lasting. Body is hazy medium to dark yellow. Aroma is moderately malty (toasted bread), lightly hoppy (flowers), lightly to moderately yeasty (cobwebs), with notes of banana/gum, lemon, pepper, clove, plastic. Flavor is moderately sweet, moderately acidic, lightly bitter. Finish is lightly sweet, moderately acidic, lightly to moderately bitter. Medium body, watery texture, lively carbonation.  Vibrant aroma, beautiful appearance, and nicely balanced...a high quality rendition.
Pale honey colour, very opaque with a beautiful head. Very pleasant aroma, buttery. Well-balanced with a short finish.

Hazy orange coloured. Medium head. Aroma is yeasty and has notes of citrus, banana and a vague hint of roastyness. Flavour is typical hefe. Has citrus and other fruit notes. Pretty well spiced. Its a well-balanced and tasty hefe.
UPDATED: JAN 28, 2003 I was travelling with a German friend in Northern Germany when he introduced me to this beer. Excellent flavours and hint of fruity-banana aftertase. Indeed enjoyable!
full vanilla custard aroma made me think of eczematic. soft and classy
Excellent German weizen. I was blessed with a fresh bottle. Nice and cloudy, dark golden color. Excellent balance of phenolics and fruity esters.
Light blond in color but opaque. The flavor can not keep the aromas promise, but still a great wheat beer. Funny picture of the brewing monks on the back that looks almost as bad as amateur porn.
Looks like wheat beer.  Smells like wheat beer.  But was a let down on the taste.  A bit thin for my liking.  Was expecting a bit more considering their Doppelbock.
Smell yeast, dough and sweet banana. Cloudy yellow a little bit greenish. Tastes fresh and tingling. Well done and balanced beer-. You get good burps out of it :-)
Big yeasty, bready nose with hints of bananas. Orange color with a tinge of green (!). Spicey, full taste. Napkin finish. Long complex profile and big and chewy. Delightful!
A milky, light brown sweet weissbier with a dry finish. A very well balanced beer.

Hazy honey gold colour with large white head. Fruit (ripe pears?) flowers and malty aromas. Medium size, very smooth, even soft, body. Wonderfull well balanced palate. Malty with hint of sour flavours and crisp dry finish. I could easily enjoy 3 or 4 of these in a row. Almost a Maisels!
It has a superb golden-yellow colour with a nice fine foam. The aroma is floral, fresh and very pleasant. It is fruity with a long, slightly spicy aftertaste.
Extremely quenching (ok - i was really thirsty when i drank it). Taste is pretty standard for a weissbier with a nice hint of almonds.
A standard geman wheat. It has a exceptionally fruity aroma with apricots, oranges and banana but other than that, not much.
UPDATED: JUL 11, 2007 i quite like it, smooth banana flavour, bit of a spritzy characteristic, also had a grassy characteristic that i didnt mind, very tasty.
cloudy honey colour, big head, lemon and banana, spicy, sweet, long aftertaste
